loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid is a 37-year old single parent living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a tailoring business that she started ten years back. She faces a challenge in price fluctuations and inflation.  Her dream is educating her children to higher institutions of learning and also moving her business to a more permanent location. Enid needs this loan to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a married woman with seven children aged between 15 and 30 years old. Cecilia's husband works as a farmer. Cecilia has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 10 years. She sells items like eggs, sugar and canned goods. Cecilia is able to help provide for her family's daily needs with her business. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soap and shampoo. Cecilia hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Nora has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy more stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Nora has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Nora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Elisa has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy more stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Elisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Elisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Grupo Antares Group

texts.es:
Ana, integrante del grupo Antares, esta muy contenta de haber sido aceptada en este crédito grupal para invertir en su negocio y proveerlo de nuevos y mejores productos. 
Ella es una joven madre de dos hijos, y con la intención de apoyar en el sustento económico familiar sin descuidar la familia, inicio en su hogar la venta de ropa, regalos y novedades de ocasión. Opto por este negocio, debido a que se facilita realizarlo desde su casa y así puede seguir atendiendo y educando a sus hijos.
Las ventas de la temporada le dieron nuevos bríos para invertir  y hacer crecer este soporte familiar que ofrece una mejor calidad de vida para los suyos.
texts.en:
Ana, a member of the group 'Antares', is very happy that she has been accepted into this loan group. She wants to invest money into her business and be able to provide new and better products. 

She is a young mother with two children. With the intention of supporting her family financially while not neglecting them, she opened a business from her home where she sells clothing, gifts and novelty items for occasions. She chose this business because it is easily done from her home and she can continue caring for and educating her children. 

Sales from this season gave higher profits to invest and support growth of her business, which offers a higher quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to invest in products to diversify her business.

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.fr:
NDEYE, est une femme de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 garçons. Elle est membre de son Banc Villageois depuis bientôt 03 ans et demi. 

Elle fait un petit commerce. Elle s'approvisionne en marchandises dans les marchés hebdomadaires de la sous-région. Elle vend de l'huile de palme, de la pâte d'arachide, des tissus, des parfums etc.. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'expérience pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis 1996.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de financer son activité de petit commerce en achetant la marchandise ci-dessus

Son objectif est de renforcer son capital pour augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement. Et ses bénéfices lui ont permis d'acheter une parcelle à titre d'habitation
texts.en:
Ndeye is a 42-year-old woman, married and the mother of four children, of whom three are boys. She has been a member of Banc Villageois for nearly three-and-a-half years.

She runs a small business. She stocks up on merchandise in the weekly markets of the sub-region. She sells palm oil, groundnut paste, fabrics, fragrances, etc. She has solid experience in this field, having worked in it since 1996.

Her new loan will allow her to finance her small business by purchasing merchandise with it.

Ndeye's intention is to build her capital in order to increase her product supply. And her profits have allowed her to purchase a residential piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil, groundnut paste, fabrics, fragrances, etc.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor Víctor nacido  en la ciudad de Cochabamba casado con la Sra. Severina  con 7 hijos, ella es ama de casa, tienen su parcela distante a 30 km de Limoncito, donde vive y trabaja en la agricultura conjuntamente con sus hijos, el crédito que ha sacado, es para la compra de semillas para la siembra de maíz y para el preparado de la tierra, ya que todas sus tierras son mecanizadas, también el señor se dedica a la ganadería, es su primer crédito que esta sacando con emprender, por lo cual se siente muy agradecido por esta oportunidad  que la institución le esta  brindando  para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Victor, born in the city of Cochabamba, is married to Severina, with 7 children. She is a housewife. They have their plot of land 30 kilometers away from Limoncito, where he lives and where he works in agriculture with his children. The loan that he has borrowed is for the purchase of corn seeds and for the preparation of the land, as all their lands are mechanized. He also makes a living from raising livestock. This is his first loan that he is taking with Emprender, so he is very grateful for the opportunity that this institution is providing to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds for planting

loans.name: Donia

texts.es:
Donia de 40 años convive con Francisco con quien tiene 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos de 17, 15 y 9 años de edad. Esta familia vive en una casa propia ubicada en el distrito de San Ramón en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Donia es una mujer agricultora. En todos estos años que lleva como madre de familia tenía que trabajar la tierra para buscar el sustento de su familia. Ella cuenta con 1 hectárea de terrenos de cultivos, en ella cultiva piñas. “De mis tierras obtengo 40 jabas de piñas y si me va bien”, comenta.
Cuando tiene tiempo, Francisco la ayuda en las labores, por que también se desempeña como cerrajero en un taller.  Así también instaló un negocio en la puerta de su casa, ahí expende refrescos, gelatinas, gaseosas; y los fines de semana prepara “Patasca” (sopa concentrada de menudencias de res o carneros con maíz). Ya tiene compradores conocidos, por eso no le faltan clientes y siempre termina vendiendo hasta el último plato. Donia considera que su principal inconveniente es la falta de capital para ampliar sus sembríos y mejorar su negocio. Éste sería su préstamo número 12 que obtendría gracias a su ayuda de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Heliconias”, se siente contenta de pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras. Comprará con el dinero bolsas de abonos orgánicos para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de piñas. Y otro porcentaje lo destinará en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su negocio de comestibles.
texts.en:
Donia is 40 years old and in a common-law marriage with Francisco. They have four children together but only three - their 17, 15, and 9 year olds - live with them. This family lives in their own house located in the district of San Ramón in Chanchamayo province. Donia is a woman who works in agriculture. In all the years since she became a mother, she has had to work the land to support her family. She has one hectare of farmland where she grows pineapples. "I get 40 crates of pineapples from my land so I am doing well," she comments.

Francisco helps Donia with her work when he has time, but he also works as a locksmith at a shop. Donia also set up a business in the front of her house, where she sells refreshments, gelatin, and soft drinks. On weekends, she also prepares "Patasca" (a concentrated soup made from beef or ram giblets and corn). She has regular customers so she never lacks for customers and always sells down to the last plate.

Donia considers her biggest disadvantage to be a lack of capital for expanding her planting and improving her business. This will be the twelfth loan that she has received thanks to the help of Microfinanzas Prisma. She promises to be punctual with her monthly repayments.

She belongs to the "Las Heliconias" communal bank. She feels happy that she belongs to a group of enterprising women. She will use this money to buy bags of organic fertilizer to scatter on her pineapple fields. She will use the other part of this loan to purchase staple goods to sell at her small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy staple products for her store and bags of fertilizer for her pineapple plants

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Angela de 53 años de edad, está casada con Juan con quien tiene 3 hijos, pero vive solo con uno de ellos. Esta familia habita una casa propia en el distrito de San Ramón, provincia de Chanchamayo. Angela es emprendedora, gracias a su empeño pudo instalar un pequeño negocio en su propia casa. Empezó hace 10 años, ahora su establecimiento está más surtido y con mayores productos. “Me va bien, lo que más se vende son los abarrotes y las carnes, principalmente la de pollo”, menciona. Por su parte, Juan se dedica  a las labores de albañilería, de esa manera aporta ingresos para el gasto diario de la familia.  Uno de sus inconvenientes fue el problema económico, cuando sus hijos se encontraban en etapas escolares. Ahora que ellos ya dejaron la casa o se desempeñan independientemente, su vida es más tranquila. Aún así, Angela trabaja en su bodega y esta pendiente que los productos de primera necesidad nunca falten. Éste sería su préstamo número 12 que obtendría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Heliconias” y sus mujeres integrantes son unidas y solidarias. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de abarrotes como sacos de arroz, de azúcar, bidones de aceite, latas de conservas y latas de leche para expenderlos en su bodega.
texts.en:
Angela, 53, is married to Juan, with whom she has three children, but lives with only one of them.  This family lives in their own house in the district of San Ramón, province of Chanchamayo.

Angela is enterprising.  Thanks to her effort she managed to set up a small business in her own house.  She began ten years ago.  Now her store is more stocked and with more products.  "It is going well for me.  What sells most are the groceries and the meat, principally chicken," she mentions.

For his part, Juan works in construction jobs.  In this way he contributes income for the daily family expenses.  One of his problems was the financial problem when his children were in school.  Now that they already left home or they work independently, his life is more calm.  Even so, Angela works in her store and watches so that the household necessities are never lacking.

This will be her twelfth loan from MFP, and she is committed to being punctual in making her payments.  She belongs to Las Heliconias Communal Bank, whose members, women, are close and supportive.

She will invest the money in buying groceries such as bags of rice and sugar, cans of oil, canned goods, and cans of milk to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and sugar, cans of oil, canned goods, and milk.

loans.name: Eduvigis

texts.es: Eduvigis de 47 años es una mujer separada de su pareja. Tiene 7 hijos pero solo vive con 3 de 21, 15 y 14 años de edad. Su casa es alquilada y se ubica en el distrito de San Ramón, provincia de Chanchamayo. Eduvigis es una madre ejemplar. A pesar de haberse separado del padre de sus hijos, tuvo el coraje para enfrentarse a la vida y mantenerlos con su esfuerzo. Es así, que hace 5 años abrió un pequeño restaurante en el lugar donde vive. Actualmente ofrece desayunos y almuerzos a los transeúntes. Y como su sazón es reconocida, también se dedica a cocinar para pensionistas de empresas constructoras. “En abril el negocio es más rentable, por el inicio de clases”, comenta, añadiendo que, en esos días los profesores y estudiantes circulan más por su zona, consumiendo los alimentos que Eduvigis prepara. Ella ansía arregla ala apariencia de su establecimiento, con algunos cuadros y con la adquisición de nuevos muebles. De esa manera seguirá apoyando a sus hijos con los pagos de sus estudios. Éste sería su préstamo número 12 que obtendría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Heliconias” y sus mujeres integrantes son unidas y solidarias. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de un estante para colocar gaseosas dentro de su restaurante. Además comprará gaseosas y algunos comestibles para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Eduvigis, 47, is a woman separated from her partner.  She has seven children but only lives with three of them, ages 21, 15, and 14.  Her house is rented and is located in the San Ramón district, province of Chanchamayo.

Eduvigis is an exemplary mother.  Despite having separated from the father of her children, she had the courage to confront life and support them with her effort.  This is how, five years ago, she opened a small restaurant in the place where she lives.

Currently she offers breakfast and lunch to passers-by.  And as her seasoning is well known, she also works cooking for residents of construction companies.  "In April the business is more profitable, owing to the beginning of classes," she comments, adding that at that time the professors and students circulate more in her area, eating the food that Eduvigis prepares.

She is anxious to fix the appearance of her business with a few paintings and by acquiring a few new pieces of furniture.  In this way she will continue helping her children with paying for their studies.

This will be the twelfth loan she would get from MFP, for which she is committed to being punctual in making her payments.  She belongs to Las Heliconias Communal Bank, and the members, women, are close and supportive.  She will invest the money in buying a shelf to put sodas inside her restaurant.  She also will buy sodas and some food to supply her business.

loans.use: to buy a shelf to store sodas and products to supply her business.

loans.name: Rodolfo Roberto

texts.es:
Rodolfo Roberto  tiene 28 años de estado civil Soltero, vive con un hermano ya que la madre fallacio, en el  Cantón Chillanes provincia  de Bolívar.

La ventanilla TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Matilde Esther perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla son 11 socios y se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz, cacao, naranja y plátano ya en esta zona es humedad y se dan estos productos, además se dedican a la crianza de animales de corral.

Rodolfo Roberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y cacao además cría pollos. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y las vende en Chillanes y en el Recinto Matilde Esther.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y cacao y para alimento cono balanceado para los pollos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener terrenos propios para aumentar la producción.

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte y festejar las fiestas del carnaval que se celebran en el mes de febrero.
texts.en:
Rodolfo Roberto is 28, single, and lives in Chillanes canton, Bolivar province. He lives with his brother now that his mother has passed away. 

The small communal bank “Trabajadores Agricolas,” or “Agricultural Workers” is located in the Matilde Esther precinct, Chillanes canton. It has 11 members and is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural work including planting corn, cocoa bean, oranges, and plantains since these are the crops that grow in this humid climate. In addition, the members also raise farm animals. 

Rodolfo Roberto raises chickens and plants corn and cocoa bean. He buys his supplies in Chillanes and sells them in Chillanes and in the Matilde Esther precinct. 

He is requesting the loan to purchase fertilizer, urea [a type of fertilizer containing nitrogen], liquid fertilizer for planting corn and cocoa bean, and for nutritious chicken feed. The loan has helped him increase his earnings for family consumption and investment. His dream is to have his own land to increase his harvest. 

In his free time, he likes to play sports and celebrate Carnaval, which takes place in February.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer, urea [a type of fertilizer containing nitrogen], liquid fertilizer for planting corn and cocoa bean, and nutritious chicken feed

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Teresita has a shop that sells coconuts for copra & homemade coconut wines. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy coconuts to sell.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell

loans.name: Roslyn

texts.en:
Roslyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Roslyn has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Roslyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Roslyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children who attend school. She owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Fatuma has operated a business selling clothes for the past five years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators. She dreams of establishing a boutique.

With the KSHS 50,000, she wants to purchase more bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jaime Irbin

texts.es:
Jaime es un joven de 21 años de edad, el vive en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad ubicada al sur de nuestra capital, la cual se caracteriza por su actividad principal que es la agricultura, Jaime vive en casa de sus padres, a los cuales el apoya con el fruto de su trabajo en los gastos del hogar y sobre todo porque él nos comenta que sus padres siempre le han dado todo cuanto han podido y que es hora de agradecer de alguna manera el cariño y la preocupación que han sentido por el.

Jaime es un joven muy trabajador, el tiene su negocio de cabinas de internet, pero no solo eso sino también reparte gas a domicilio por las mañanas, en la tarde se dedica a su negocio de internet y por las noches estudia la carrera de administración, es un joven muy proactivo y luchador, ya que distribuye su tiempo entre las 3 actividades, y es que el nos dice que todo se puede logran solo basta tener fe y hacer las cosas con ganas, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy ordenado y atiende bien a los clientes, así como también porque su hermana lo apoya mucho cuando él se no se encuentra en el negocio.

Jaime está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá comprar 2 computadoras más para su negocio, con ello tendrá mas maquinas disponibles para atender a los clientes, con ello sus clientes estarán más satisfechos con sus servicios y tendrá mayores ingresos para poder seguir ahorrando y cumplir sus más grandes sueños:” Terminar su Carrera universitaria, ampliar su negocio y Ser el orgullo de sus Padres”.
texts.en:
Jaime is a young man of 21. He lives in the city of Imperial, located south of our capital. The area's main activity is farming.

Jaime lives in his parents' home, and he contributes to the household expenses with what he earns from his work. This is especially because his parents have always provided him with everything he needed, and now, he says, is the time to thank them in some way for the caring and concern that they have felt for him. 

Jaime is a very hard-working young man. He has an Internet café business, but not only that.  He also does home gas delivery in the mornings, works in his internet business in the afternoon, and studies for a degree in Administration in the evenings.

He is a proactive and determined young man, as he divides his time among the three activities. He tells us that you can achieve everything; all you need is to have faith and do things with enthusiasm. He thinks that it's going well with his business because he is very organized, serves customers well, and also because his sister helps him lot when he isn't in the café.

Jaime is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he will be able to buy two more computers for his business. This way he will have more machines available to serve customers, and they will be more satisfied with his services. This way he will have more income, so that he will be able  to continue saving, and fulfill his greatest dreams:  "Completing his university degree, expanding his business, and being his parents' pride.”

loans.use: To buy computers.

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en: Zaki is 31 years old and married. Together, the hard working couple is blessed with one child. Zaki is a taxi driver and has been in service for six years. He faces several challenges like the high fuel prices and inadequate capital to support his family. He wishes to diversify and venture into brick laying. Zaki hopes to build a permanent house and buy his own car in the future. Zaki needs the loan facility to pay workers who are laying his bricks.

loans.use: to pay workers who are laying his bricks.

loans.name: Quirino

texts.en:
Quirino is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. 

Quirino is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for 13,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Quirino has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Quirino hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline

loans.name: Abdurabi

texts.ru: Абдураби более пяти лет занимается торговлей. У него имеется продуктовый магазин. Ему 53 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Абдураби берет кредит для покупки фруктов.
texts.en: Abdurabi has been involved in small business for more than five years.  He owns a grocery store.  He is 53 years old and married, with four children.  He is taking a loan to buy fruits.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Marina has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Marina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Marina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a 33-year-old married woman with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. She has been operating a retail shop for 10 years and this has facilitated her in supporting her family. Her major challenge is price fluctuation and her dream is to have a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with six children. 

Pilar has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Pilar has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Pilar hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Sorateñas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SORATEÑAS” iniciará su quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Karina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de fruta, venta de ropa interior, venta de carne de ovino, venta de chamarras, venta de ropa de bebe, tejido de chompa.

La señora Karina,  indica que es el segundo año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de sus familiares. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de fruta que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará de forma ambulante (sin lugar de comercialización fijo). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para sobrellevar su vida, pues ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The unincorporated association “Sorateñas” will begin their fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer. Making up the focal point of Los Andes, the group is comprised of eight members and is governed by a board of directors, led by Karina. The members of the communal association engage in a variety of business activities, including selling fruit, underwear, mutton, jackets, baby clothing and woollen jumpers. 

Karina tells us that this is the second year that she has worked with Pro Mujer, after having been invited to join the group by one of her relatives. She is currently running a business selling fruit, which she has been doing for some time.

The loan that Karina has applied for will be used to add to her capital (purchasing fruit) which she will get from La Paz and later sell as a street vendor, as she has no fixed area where she can sell her products. This line of work allows her to generate an income to make a life for herself, as she is single. 

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, Karina responded that she liked the area of health.

loans.use: to purchase fruit

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 33 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Шоира год как занимается скотоводством. Она закупает скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Shoira lives in the city of Khujand.  She is 33 years old, married, with two children.  Shoira has been involved in animal husbandry for a year.  She buys cattle for future resale.  She is taking a loan to buy some bulls.

loans.use: to purchase bulls.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Cornelia has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Cornelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Cornelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Ana has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Ana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Laureta

texts.en:
Laureta is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Laureta has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Laureta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Laureta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Teresa has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Teresa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Teresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita  vive en una localidad pequeña  vive en unión libre con el señor Aricel y con quien procreo  un hijo y aun esta a su responsabilidad.

 El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de  frutas y verduras en donde lleva trabajando dos años en año que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello a sacado adelante a su familia.

Se inspiro por si sola a para apoyar a  su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y poder darle lo más necesario a su pequeño hijo.

 Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella pueda seguir trabajando para si  rentar un local en donde pueda vender sus  frutas.
texts.en:
Margarita lives in a small village. She is in a common-law relationship with Aricel, and they have a child who is still their responsibility.

She will use the loan to buy fruits and vegetables. She has been working in this activity for two years, and says that it is going well, as with this she has helped her family get ahead in life.

She was self-motivated to support her husband by contributing to the household income, and to provide the basic necessities to her small child.

What she most wishes, is that with this small business she can continue working, so that she can rent a small shop where she can sell her fruit.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

Veronica has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Veronica has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Veronica hopes to improve her business.

Lucie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lucie hopes to improve her business.

loans.name: Flor De Coca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE COCA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Francisca es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: elaboración de mantas de vicuña, venta de joyas, artesanía en miniaturas, venta de algodones de azúcar, ventas de mantas, tejido de mantas, venta de ropa, taller de joyería.

La señora Francisca,  indica que es el tercer año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de promotoras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas que viene trabajando hace años haciendo el negocio solo con sus amigas.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las agencias distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le ayuda a poyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
texts.en:
The unincorporated association “Coca flower” will begin their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela office. The group is made up of eight members and is directed by a governing committee which Francisca forms part of as treasurer. 

The members of the communal association engage in a variety of business activities, including making vicuna blankets, knitting and selling blankets, running a jewellery workshop and selling jewellery, making handcrafts in miniature, selling clothes and selling fairy floss.

Francisca tells us that this is the third year she has worked for Pro Mujer after being invited to join as a member by one of the institution’s promoters. She now runs a business knitting blankets, which she has been doing for many years, doing business only amongst her friends.

The loan that she is applying for will increase her capital through the purchase of wool, which she will obtain through distributing agencies. Later, she will make and sell her wares depending on the orders she receives. This field of work helps her to support her family, as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, Francisca responded that she liked the office.

loans.use: to purchase wool

loans.name: Ricci

texts.en:
Ricci is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Ricci has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Ricci has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ricci hopes to improve her business.

loans.name: Lois

texts.en:
Lois is a sixty-eight-year-old woman who is married and a mother of two children. She runs a cereal shop  in Emali. Lois has been in the business for seven years now and gets a monthly income of sixty thousand shillings.

This will be Lois’ fifth loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more foodstuff for her cereals shop. She wants to use the profit that she will get to buy a piece of land. 

In the future she wants to expand her cereals shop to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff for her cereals shop.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a hardworking man with four children living in a semi permanent house in Masindi, Uganda.

He has been operating a bakery for over five years and this has enabled him to pay school fees for his children and also provide other basics for his family. His challenge is high costs of inputs and his dream is to move his business to a more permanent location. Alex needs the loan facility to buy baking powder.

loans.use: to buy baking powder.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:

Marites has a junk-shop that buys and sells recycled materials like plastics and metals. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy recycled materials like plastics and metals to sell.

Marites has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials like plastics and metals to sell.

Divina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Divina hopes to improve her business.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Dolores has a shop that sells school and office supplies such as reams of bond paper and paper clips. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of office and school supplies to sell.

Dolores has been a member of HSPFI since 2004. In the future, Dolores hopes to improve her business.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 53 years old and is a married woman with four children. She runs a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol. Diosdada sells items like soft drinks, vinegar, sugar and canned goods. Diosdada has had her business for five years.

Diosdada has requested this loan to buy food and other items to sell such as soft drinks and rice. Diosdada hopes to have better income so she can continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy food and other items to sell such as soft drinks and rice.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 41 years old and married with three children who are aged between 24 and 17 years of age. They live in Nakuru town.

Beatrice has a tailoring business that she has been doing for the past five years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy more material to sell.

She hopes to expand her business and open a boutique.

loans.use: To buy material to add to her stock.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a a forty-nine-year-old single mother of four children living in Masindi, Uganda. For five years she has been a market vendor selling clothes. Her challenge is that she has inadequate capital to set up a boutique and the scorching sun hinders her ability to stay longer in markets.

Eva needs the loan facility to pay rent so she can set up a boutique.

loans.use: to pay rent so she can set up a boutique.

Elton has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elton hopes to improve his business.

Jenilyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with five children one of whom attends school. Her husband is a pastor who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Hellen has operated a retail shop for the past five years; in addition she also sells charcoal and runs a motorbike transportation business. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her businesses.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, cereals and soap for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, cereals and soap for resale.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:

Milagros has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Milagros hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make homemade sausage.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:

Leoncia has requested this loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs. Leoncia hopes this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Andres Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Andrés  se dedica  a prestar servicio de amplificación y juego de luces, amenizando todo tipo de acontecimientos ya sea bautizos matrimonios, fiestas de quince años,  cuenta con 40 años de edad, es padre de familia, tiene tres hijas que se encuentran en edad escolar, vive en la zona Santa Rosa, su actividad económica es de prestar servicio de luces y sonido por mas de 13 años, además de el contar con un trabajo en las funciones de auxiliar contable, que eso ayuda a con los gastos del hogar, tiene varias secuencias en la institución ya es un cliente antiguo, con el dinero del crédito comprara un poder de amplificación, para mejorar el servicio que rinda,  el Sr. Andrés  se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad que se le brinda para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Andrés hires out amplifiers and supplies lighting to provide entertainment for all types of events from baptisms and weddings to 15th birthday parties. He is 40 years of age, a father to three school-aged daughters and lives in the Santa Rosa area. 

Andrés has provided a sound and lighting service for more than 13 years. In addition to this job he also works as an assistant accountant, which helps to cover household costs. He is an old client of the lending organisation and has already gone through several loan cycles with them. 

With the money he will gain from this loan Andrés will buy a pre-amplifier to improve the service he provides to his clients. Andrés is very grateful for this opportunity which will allow him to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a pre-amplifier

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a forty-four year old woman, she is married and the mother of four children. She carries out agricultural activities and offers computer services in Oloitoktok. Mary has been in the business for six years now and has a monthly income of eleven thousand nine hundred shillings.

This will be Mary’s first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to improve her agricultural activities and buy more computer accessories for her business. With the profit that she will get she wants to improve on her agricultural business and expand her computer business. In the future she wants to be able to expand her agricultural activities and computer services.

loans.use: To improve her agricultural activities and buy more computer accessories for her business.

loans.name: Syprine

Since taking out her last Kiva loan, Syprine has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is married and has four children. Esi cooks rice and a traditional food known as 'banku' for sale in the town of Adum Banso. She has done this for six years now. Her husband is a farmer. Esi uses her income to help her husband provide for their family. 

Esi will use the loan to buy bags of rice and maize to cook and sell. With the new profits, Esi plans to expand her business.

loans.use: buy bags of rice and maize to cook and sell.

loans.name: Romy

texts.en:
Romy is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Romy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for eight years. He requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Romy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Romy hopes to improve his business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 28 years old. He is married to a Nyokabia business woman and together they have one child, aged two. 

Daniel provides artificial insemination services to farmers in his area. He has been in the business for the past four years. He gets a monthly income of KES 25,000 from the business. 

This is his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use the whole amount to purchase more tubes for use in his business. His dream is to invest in rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase more tubes for use in his business.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita de 57 años está casada con Zenón con quien tiene 2 hijos, pero solo 2 están en su poder. Ella y su familia viven en una casa propia en el distrito de San Ramón, provincia de Chanchamayo. Felicita es una mujer que trabaja duro. Siempre ve oportunidades para iniciar un negocio. Cuando sus hijos tuvieron mayores necesidades en el estudio tenía que ingeniárselas para generar más ingresos y no depender solo del sueldo de su esposo. De esa manera empezó preparando dulces tradicionales como las “Chapanas”, que se elaboran a base de harina de yuca y azúcar; pero lo que más vende son los tamales, hechos con maíz molido y relleno de carne; así también, platos de patasca (sopa tradicional concentrada de menudencias de res o carnero). “Tengo pedidos para empresas, y llevo 50, 70, hasta 120 tamales por la tarde”, comenta, pero para ello tiene que despertarse temprano para prepararlos. Ya se acostumbró a la rutina y ya cuenta con clientes fijos, a quienes distribuye los alimentos. Por las tardes también reparte refrescos helado y chupetes de frutas.
Es así que mantiene a su familia. Felicita es muy ingeniosa. Éste sería su préstamo número 12 que obtendría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Su banco comunal se llama “Las Heliconias” y se siente contenta de compartir intereses con sus compañeras. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumos para preparar los tamales, como son: maíz pelado, carne de pollo y condimentos. Así como las menudencias y demás ingredientes para seguir con el negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitia is 57, and has 2 children with her husband Zenón, but only two are in her power. She and her family live in their own home in the San Ramón district, Chanchamayo province. 

Felicita is a hardworking woman. She always sees opportunities to begin a business. When her children had increased needs for their studies, she had to think creatively to generate more income and not have to depend on her husband’s income. Thus she started making traditional sweets such as “chapanas,” that she makes with yucca flour and sugar. What sell best, however, are her tamales, made from milled corn and filled with meat. She also makes “patasca” (traditional soup with beef or mutton giblets). “I have requests for businesses, and I make 50, 70, up to 120 tamales for the afternoon,” she says. But to do so, she has to wake up early to prepare the tamales. She’s become accustomed to the routine and has regular customers, to whom she distributes the dishes. In the afternoon, she also delivers chilled soft drinks and fruit lollipops.

She supports her family with this business. Felicita is very enterprising. This will be her 12th loan from MFP, and she commits to being punctual with her monthly payments. Her communal bank is named “Las Heliconias,” and she is happy to share interests with her fellow members. She will invest the money in tamale ingredients, such as husked corn, chicken, and seasoning, as well as giblets and other ingredients to continue with her business.

loans.use: purchase husked corn, chicken, and other ingredients to prepare tamales

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a forty-four-year-old married man, the father of three children. Ahmad loves animals a lot, so to fulfill his financial needs and enjoy his passion, ten years ago, he opened a small pet shop. Over the years he has developed it into a bigger shop filled with different species and attractive animals with special shapes and colors. This is his only source of income which is why he works hard to improve it and keep his animals in good health.

Ahmad is a hardworking man, he is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy special birds and marine animals. In addition he wants to increase his stock with new models of cages, animal food, and many other products. 

Ahmad hopes to keep on working hard to develop his business and social life as much as he can.

loans.use: To buy special birds and marine animals as well as stock in order to improve his business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is applying for another loan to educate her children. She will use this KES 33,500 loan to pay school fees for her children. In the future, Angelina aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Angelina has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa Ama

texts.en: Adjoa Ama is married to a mason and has four children. Adjoa Ama is a baker, she bakes bread for sale in the town of Adum Banso. Adjoa Ama has been baking for five years now. She uses her income to help her husband to pay their accommodation bills. She will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and oil for her bakery. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her bakery.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar and oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Okari

texts.en:

This will be Okari’s second loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock for his business. With the profit, he will expand his business and buy more stock.

In future he wants to invest in large-scale curios business and rentals.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:

This will be Lucy’s first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to buy a dairy goat to rear for milk production. With the profit that she will get she wants to increase the number of dairy cows she has.

In the future she wants to be able to own a herd of dairy cows and expand her farming by rearing pigs.

loans.use: To buy a dairy goat.

loans.name: Elsa

Elsa has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.name: Melanie

Melanie is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Melanie has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Melanie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Melanie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with seven children, one of whom attends school while six have completed school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her child. 

Mary has operated a tailoring business for the past 20 years; in addition she also runs a café. Her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to pay school fees for her child. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards and expand her businesses.

loans.name: Edmelda

Edmelda has a shop that sells green bananas and coconuts for copra. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

Edmelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Edmelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new printer and colored ink.

loans.name: Azucena

Azucena is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Azucena has a shop that makes and sells snacks like rice cakes, puto and sweet corn. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients to make snacks.

Azucena has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Azucena hopes to improve her business.

loans.name: Aisha

Aisha is applying for another loan to expand her food stall business. She will use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, beans, cooking oil, rice and to repair chairs she uses in her business. In the future, Aisha aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Aisha has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, beans, cooking oil, rice and repair chairs she uses in her business.

loans.name: Sop Cheikh Modou Awa Balla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe sop cheikh Modou Awa Balla a été créé 21septembre 2010 le jour du 1er financement du Banc Villageois. IL est composé de 6 membres issus du même village et qui sont unies par des liens de parenté et de voisinage, Elle font toutes du petit commerce.

Elles ont pour responsable Mame Faty. Elle est âgée de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants avec 02 autres en charge. 

Elle fait le commerce d'habits de bébé. Depuis des années elle même cette activité. 

Son prêt va lui permettre d'acheter des habits. 

Son objectif est d'augmenter ses revenus pour pouvoir construire une boutique et résoudre ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The group Sop Cheikh Modou Awa Balla was created on September 21, 2010, the day of Banc Villageois' first financing. It is made up of 6 members from the same village who are united by blood and neighborhood connections. All the women conduct some small business.

Mame Faty is in charge. She is 42 years old, married, the mother of five children, and responsible for two others.

She has had a baby clothing business for many years and conducts this business herself.

The loan will allow her to buy clothing.

Her objective is to increase her earnings in order to be able to build a shop and resolve some personal needs.

loans.use: to buy some clothing.

loans.name: Emerson

texts.en:
Emerson is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children.
 
Emerson has a barber shop that provides hair cutting and styling. He has had this business for eight years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy materials he needs and to pay for the electricity that he uses in the shop. 

Emerson has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Emerson hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for the electricity he needs in his barber shop.

loans.name: Afif

texts.en:
Afif is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three children all of whom who still attend school. He is trying his best to support the family and pay his children’s educational fees. 

Afif has been working as a car painter since 1999 and has his own garage. Today, he needs to borrow $1,800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more car paints for his business. This will keep him up to date and allow him to propose new colors to his customers. In the future, he plans to open a bigger garage.

loans.use: to purchase more car paints for his business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 29-year-old single man. He's been working as a barber for ten years. This extensive experience encouraged him to open his own barber shop in 2007, attracting all his friends, neighbors and relatives as his customers.

Mohamad always works to improve his business in order to keep his customers pleased. That is why he is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to change the floor tiles and do necessary sanitary maintenance in his shop.

Mohamad is very optimistic, and he's sure that his business will expand soon with the help of Al Majmoua, and of course with the support of his customers.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance of his barber shop.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Susan has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Susan has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Susan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Forty-six-year-old Macaria is a married woman with three children aged twelve, eighteen and twenty-one. She works as a farmer in Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband, who is also a farmer, mainly manages their rice farm. Macaria works hard to support her husband in keeping their farm productive. She also makes sure to take care of her children.

Macaria has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and other farm inputs. Macaria hopes to have a better income so they can sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Reynan

texts.en:
Reynan is thirty-one years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 

Reynan provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the motorela services.

Reynan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Reynan hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle transport service.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel está aplicando a su segundo credikiva, con el cual comprará cerdos, carneros para el sacrificio, aprovechando resulta ser de gran bendición para su negocio, porque las compras se incrementan y él puede vender fácilmente de contado y en mayor volumen. También con sus buenas ventas obtendrá mejores utilidades para apoyar el sustento de su hogar y aumentar su bienestar. Con su credikiva anterior le fue muy bien y por eso está muy satisfecho porque compró insumos para la producción de miel, marcos, cera cajas y techos para sus colmenas.
texts.en: Miguel is applying for his second credikiva with which he will buy pigs, sheep for slaughter, taking advantage of the good time for his business because sales have increased and he is able to sell them easily retail and wholesale. With his good sales he will have greater earnings to support his home and increase his wellbeing. With his previous credikiva, Miguel, did very well which is why he is so content since he bought the merchandize needed to make honey like frames, honeycombs, boxes and roofs for his beehives.

loans.use: buy pigs and sheep for slaughter.

loans.name: Luis German

texts.es: Luis de 56 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y tiene un hijo de 16 años. El es propietario de un negocio de variedades y de una peluquería donde ofrece servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal a hombres, mujeres y niños; así mismo vende en su miscelánea productos de belleza y accesorios femeninos y para el hogar. Su negocio lo inició hace diez años, cuando  quedó desempleado trabajando en una peluquería y aprovechó su experiencia para dedicarse a esa misma actividad. Gradualmente fue agregando otros productos, aprovechando su clientela doméstica, a quien asesoraba a cerca del uso de los productos cosméticos y así inició otra fuente de ingresos en su mismo espacio comercial. En la actualidad tiene su propia casa, gracias al apoyo que le dio la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, en el macroproyecto Ciudad Bicentenario, y con este ha recibido dos financiamientos, para capital de trabajo por parte de esta organización. Con su credikiva comprará mercancías, que vienen en descuentos en sus guías especializadas de productos, como cosméticos y productos de belleza, que acompaña con sus ya famosas asesorías en belleza y estética. Su meta más adelante es tener un gran local, para mudar su negocio a un espacio mucho más confortable, con el fin de continuar mejorando su servicio al cliente.
texts.en: Luis is 56 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena and has a 16 year old son. He is the owner of a miscellaneous shop and a hairdresser/barbershop where he offers personal image improvement for men, women and children; at the same time he sells his miscellaneous beauty products and accessories for women and the home. Luis began his business ten years ago when he became unemployed after working in a hairdresser/barbershop and took advantage of his experience to open his own shop. Little by little, he began to add new products and taking advantage of his family clientele whom he gave advice about beauty products and that is how another source of income started in his workplace. At present, Luis lives in his own home thanks to the support given to him by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in the Bicentenary City macroproject, where he received two loans as work capital. With his credikiva he will buy merchandize that are on sale in his specialized product guides like makeup and beauty products that go with his already famous beauty and aesthetic accessories. Luis’ goal is to have a great place to move his business, a more comfortable space to keep improving his customer service.

loans.use: buy merchandize on sale like makeup and beauty products.

loans.name: Alcatraces Group

texts.es:
Anita, perteneciente del grupo Alcatraces, esposa y madre de dos hijos, se dedica a distribuir deliciosas tortillas de harina. A ella le gusta mucho preparar comidas, y en festividades del año o días especiales preparaba tortillas de harina para compartir con sus vecinas. Tenía la costumbre de llevarles y siempre eran muy bien recibidas. Se dio la ocasión en que algunas vecinas, le preguntaban “si no le habían quedado tortillas” a la hora de la comida porque tenían antojo. Fue entonces que sus hijos la motivaron a iniciar un micronegocio por pedido, fijar un precio y hacer cuando se lo requerían.
Anita ha solicitado este crédito para renovar su equipo de trabajo y establecer un espacio dentro de casa dedicado al negocio.
Ahora ella recibe con frecuencia estas solicitudes para satisfacer este rico antojo y además comenzó a distribuir en tiendas de abarrotes cercanas.
texts.en: Anita is a member of the Alcatraces group and is married with two children.  She earns her living distributing delicious flour tortillas.  She enjoys preparing food, especially for festive holidays during the year to share with her neighbors.  When she took them around they were always well received.  Several of her neighbors began asking for her tortillas at mealtimes when they were desired.  As a result, her children suggested that she start a small business to respond to client orders, fixing prices and making tortillas when they were needed.  Anita seeks this credit to operationalize her equipment for making flour tortillas and to establish a space within her home for her business acitivities.  Now she receives frequent client orders and is even distributing to nearby stores.

loans.use: to acquire equipment for making flour tortillas

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es: Anibal con su credikiva compró repuestos para computadores , quemadores, memorias, parlantes, filtros y hasta le alcanzo para comprar mercancia variada que vendió como juguetes y musica. Con su nuevo crédito comprará pantalones colegiales, camisas, y productos de papelería pues se prpara para la temporada de colegios y desde ya quiere tener todo lo que sus clientes exigen usualmente. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Que sigan apoyando esta labor, porque es muy importante para el mejoramiento de la vida de muchas comunicdades y tambien en el logro de muchos sueños , tambien quiero desearles, feliz navidad en nombre de mi familia."
texts.en: Anibal used his Credikiva loan to buy computer spare parts: burners, memory drives, speakers, filters, and even had some left over to buy miscellaneous merchandise, which he sold as toys and music.  With the new loan he plans to buy school trousers, shirts and stationery products since he is getting ready for the school year to begin and wants to have on hand everything his customers usually request.  His message to the Kiva lenders is the following:  "Please continue supporting this initiative because it is very important in improving lives in many communities and in helping many dreams come true.  I also want to wish you a Merry Christmas on behalf of my family.".

loans.use: To buy school trousers, shirts and stationery products.

loans.name: Mbene

texts.fr: Madame Mbene   est une femme âgée  de 45 ans qui habite au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 5 et 18 ans. Elle évolue depuis plus de 10 ans dans le commerce et la vente de poissons. Les revenus de mari étant insuffisants  pour supporter les charges  quotidiennes, elle a choisi cette activité pour se procurer des revenus et venir en aide a la famille. Par conséquent c’est l’aspect lucratif qui l’intéresse  le plus dans son activité. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis septembre 2009. Elle a déjà remboursé 2 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs montant avec lequel elle compte s’approvisionner en poissons pour les revendre a ses clients. Ainsi son objectif est de maintenir le niveau de son activité pour pouvoir continuer à soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mbene, age 45, lives in Senegal. She's married and the mother of five children, whose ages range from 5 to 18. For more than ten years, she's been a merchant selling fish. 

Since her husband's income is not enough to take care of the daily expenses, she chose this business to earn an income and help her family. As a consequence, she's mainly interested in the lucrative aspect of her business.

She's been a member of one of UIMCEC's branches since September 2009, and already repaid two previous loans. She's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000, which she intends to use to purchase fish supplies to resell to her customers.

Her goal is to maintain her level of business in order to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Bousso Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Mame Diarra Bousso a été crée le 21 septembre 2010. Il est composé de 12 femmes issues de la même localité qui sont unies par des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles exercent la même activité le commerce.

Oumy(Debout à droite sur la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 25 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02enfants et a en charge 01 autre enfant sa cousine. 

Elle fait le petit commerce d'habits (pagnes brodés) des colliers en perle, des légumes. Avec son prêt reçu, elle va renforcer son activité. 

Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille et de satisfair ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Solidarity Group Sop Mame Diarra Bousso was established on September 21, 2010. It is made up of twelve women from the same village. They got united by bonds of kinship and neighborhood, and are all merchants.

Oumy, standing on the right in the photograph, is responsible for the group. She's 25 years old, married, and the mother of two children. In addition, she also has to support one of her cousin's children.

She retails clothes, such as embroidered "pagnes" (colorful African cloth), pearl necklaces, and vegetables. With her loan, she will bolster her business.

Her profits will enable her to support her husband in taking care of the family, and to provide for her own personal needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 1 child. 

Laura has a computer shop that provides computer and online games where customers drop coins into computers.  She has had this business for 6 years.  She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to pay for the electricity for the computer services.

Laura has been a member of HSPFI since 2010 .  In the future, Laura hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To pay for the electricity for the computer services.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 24 years old, single and has run a retail shop for the past five years.  The business earns him a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

He has requested for a loan worth KES 30,000 to expand his business by buying more stock like stationery, milk, soda for sale. 

Edwin says that his profit from the business will assist him to further his education because he is still in college.  His hope and dream is to become a reliable business entity to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more stock like stationery, milk, soda for sale.

loans.name: Jocylita

texts.en:
Jocylita is fifty years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Jocylita has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jocylita has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Jocylita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 5 children. 

Cecelia has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Cecelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Cecelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 33 years old from Nakuru and is married to Sylvester.  They have three children who are between the ages of 13 and six years old.

Annie has a food stall that she has run for the past 14 years.  She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, to enable her buy more fruits for sale. 

She hopes to expand her business and open more stalls.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for sale.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 52-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children who one of whom is studying while the others are working. He’s the one responsible for his family, and doing the best he can to enrich their standard of living. 

Hasan decided to open his own cattle farm in 1990 and already has thirty years of experience in this domain. He likes his job and knows very well that with a little more care, the business will grow faster. Today, he’s requesting a loan of $3,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase cattle in order to raise them and increase his milk production. He notes that this will help to develop his business and augment his profits. In the future, he plans to enlarge his farm by purchasing additional animals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle in order to raise them and increase his milk production.

loans.name: Dominico

texts.en:
Dominico is 53 years old, married and a father of two children. He runs a retail shop in Mpeketoni, Lamu and has been in the business for the last twelve years, with a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his first loan of KES 40,000 from the company. He intends to use it to add additional stock of cooking oil, wheat flour and Vaseline to sell. 

He will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for his children. In future, he hopes to grow his business and turn it into a well stocked supermarket.

loans.use: to add additional stock of cooking oil, wheat flour and Vaseline to sell.

loans.name: Arline

texts.en:
Arline is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Arline has a shop that makes and sells snacks like pancakes and rice cakes. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients to make snacks. 

Arline has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Arline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 4 children. 

Cynthia has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Cynthia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Cynthia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 9 children. 

Virginia has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 15 years.  She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 25 year old business man who sells second hand shoes in Mariakani.  He has been selling shoes to his customers for the past one year and he is doing great. 

This marks his first business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business.  He plans to add more stock of second hand shoes for sale. 

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and expand his business further.  He hopes to have a bigger and more profitable business.

loans.use: To add more stock of second hand shoes for sale.

loans.name: Mayra Auxiliadora

texts.es: Mayra Auxiliadora es una emprendedora que ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, en cual es una persona responsable y nos expresa ella que gracias al financiamiento ha aumentado su inventario y sus clientes, ya que hoy en día a sus clientes les ofrece variedad de ropa, cosméticos, zapatos. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para esta temporada que es buena en el cual quiere aprovechar, ella comprara con el crédito ropa de todo estilo, cosmetido, zapatos entre otros productos que demandan.
texts.en:
Mayra Auxiliadora is an entrepreneur that has had a loan with Fundación León 2000. She is a responsible person and tells us that thanks to the financing her inventory and customers have increased since these days she offers them a variety of clothing, cosmetics, and shoes.

Currently she is requesting a loan for this season she wants to take advantage of. With the loan she will buy clothing of all styles, cosmetics, and shoes, among other products that her customers want.

loans.use: to buy clothing of all styles, cosmetics, and shoes, among other products in demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 2 children. 

Gina has a green house that sells fruit trees and non-fruit trees seedlings.  She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for fruit trees seedlings.

Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2009 .  In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for fruit trees seedlings.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
43-year-old Marites is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol.  She is married with 4 children who are between the ages of 8 and 15 years old.

Marites primarily grows rice crops to sell to her community.  She earns 5,000 PHP per month with her business.  Marites works hard to increase her harvest to earn more money.  She said she wants the best for her family.  Marites plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.  This will help Marites achieve a better yield.

Marites hopes for her children to finish college and have brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 29-year-old married woman with 2 children who are enrolled in school.  Her husband is a chef who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Rebecca has operated a motorbike transportation business for the past 1 year; her potential clients are the local area residents.  She faces a major challenge of rough roads which make it difficult to work.  She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase another motorbike for her business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike for her business.

loans.name: Ainea

texts.en:
Ainea is 46 years old. He is from Nakuru and is married to Lina. They have four children who are aged between nineteen and ten years of age. 

Ainea is in the animal sales business. He has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy more goats to rear and sell later at a profit. 

He hopes to own as many cows as possible in the future.

loans.use: To buy more goats to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 43-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her two working siblings. They’re all cooperating together to be able to cover their expenses. As for Zahra, she has been working as a private teacher since 1995 from her home. She’s intelligent and expert in her field. In parallel, she has been teaching in a local school since 1990. 

Today, she’s asking for a loan of $1,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to build a room where she can teach her students and have some privacy. In that way, she will be able to develop her way of teaching thus her communication with her students. In the future, she plans to open her own learning center.

loans.use: to build a room where she can teach her students and have some privacy.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is forty-four years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with eleven children. 

Allan provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline he uses for his motorela services.

Allan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Allan hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a fifty-one-year-old rental houses owner in Kilifi. He is married and a father of twelve. He has been a landlord for the past twenty years with great success. 

This is Ronald’s second business loan from KADET LTD. He plans to renovate his rental houses. He will use the anticipated profits to construct more residential houses to rent. 

He hopes to sufficiently support his family.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Khadijeh

texts.en:
Khadijeh is a 32-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married and lives with her husband and three school-age children. She joins forces with her husband in order to cover their life expenses and pay the cost of their children's studies. 

Khadijeh opened her own flower shop in 2004; she also has a small clothing area in the shop. Today, she wants to borrow $1,300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy added products for her shop such as flowers and a new collection of clothes. This will certainly increase the number of customers asking for her services and therefore her revenues. In the future, she plans to enlarge her shop by adding diverse kinds of flowers.

loans.use: to buy added products for her shop such as flowers and a new collection of clothes.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Forty-one-year-old Alma is a married woman with five children aged between eleven and nineteen. Alma's husband works as a fisherman.

Alma runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells items like spices, coffee, soap and shampoo. Alma earns about PHP 5,000 with her store. She said the store is helpful in providing for her family's daily needs. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as coffee, canned goods and noodles. She hopes to have a progressive business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as coffee, canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
