She’s been in the communal bank for more than 8 years and likes it because she used the first loan to start her clothing business.  Her dream is to continue forward and that she and her loved ones are in good health.

loans.use: to buy sea food and articles of clothing.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de chicha que es una bebida a base de maiz,la socia tambien se esta dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes,pollos y chanchos,la socia los hace engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la chicha y los animales.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes,pollos y chanchos y tambien para comprar maiz para preparar la chicha.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues to sell chicha which is a beverage made from corn.  She also is raising animals like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.  She fattens them up and then sells them in various street markets that exist.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell the chicha and the animals.  She’s asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs, chickens and pigs and also to buy corn to make chicha.  She’s happy with the loan and committed to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and corn.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: La socia continua con su trabajo y conla atencion y administracion de sus propia tienda de abarrotes; la socia desea en esta ocasión como en la anterior invertir el prestamo en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, harina, aceite entre otros. La socia tiene el sueño de ver a su familia realizada y prospera.
texts.en: She continues working tending to and running her own grocery store.  On this occasion, like previously, she wants to use the loan to buy basic staple goods like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, flour and oil, among others.  Her dream is to see her family fulfilled and prosperous.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mahmadsami

texts.ru: Махмадсами проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 43 года. Он разведен. Он уже два года как занимается торговлей на рынке. Махмадсами имеет торговую точку, где продает фрукты. Целью получения кредита является покупка зимних фруктов.
texts.en: Mahmadsami lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 43 years old and divorced. He has worked with trade at the market for two years. Mahmadsami owns a retail stand, where he sells fruit. The purpose of getting a loan is to buy winter fruit.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for sale

loans.name: Yaned

texts.es:
La socia anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de tienda de abarrotes pero no le fue muy bien en este negocio,la socia ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,ella vende estofado de pollo,pollo al horno y sopas,ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,carne,pollo y verduras.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She used to run a grocery store but didn’t do too well in this business.  Now, she’s working in a food preparation business; she sells chicken stew, roasted chicken and soups.  She sells in an ambulatory way from 8am until 7pm and is able to support her children with this business.  Her dream is to own a restaurant.  She’s asking for the loan to buy ingredients to cook like rice, meat, chicken and vegetables.  She’s happy with the loan and committed to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Nancy;La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de queso, yogurt y manjar ella prepara estos productos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia lleva años en este negocio siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia vende en las ferias y mercados donde estan sus clientes que le solicitan,a la vez la socia se dedica a la ganaderia ,la socia es una persona bien responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboracion de sus quesos,yogurt y manjar como azucar.
texts.en:
Nancy alternates her daily activities with a business selling cheese, yogurt and ‘manjar’ [a sweet].  She makes these products and then sells them to customers that request them.  

She’s been in this business for years and this is the way she supports her family.  She sells in markets and street markets where her customers are.  She also raises livestock.  She’s quite a responsible person who very much wants to get ahead.

She’s asking for the loan to buy ingredients to make cheese and yoghurt and ingredients, like sugar, for the manjar.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make cheese, yoghurt and "manjar."

loans.name: Sharof

texts.ru: Шароф занимается развозкой грузов по городу Истаравшан. Этим видом деятельности он занимается два года. Он женат. Ему 28 лет. У него трое детей. Он берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en:
Sharof works with transporting goods in the city of Istaravshan. He has been engaged in this activity for two years. He is married, and he is 28 years old. He has three children. 

Sharof takes a loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Richard

texts.es: Richard de 27 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y responsable; vive en su propia casa junto con su esposa Raquel de 26 años y sus 03 hijos quienes son el motivo de esfuerzo por sobresalir en el futuro. Hace 10 años que Richard junto a su esposa empezaron a trabajar en propia chacras, pero ellos querían un bienestar para sus hijos y con sus ahorros lograron tener su propia tienda de abarrotes. Hoy, se sienten muy contentos ya que han cumplido con uno de sus primeros objetivos, lo cual le está arrojando buenos resultados económicos, debido a la calidad y la variedad de productos que ofrece a su clientela. Normalmente trabajan por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. Su punto de venta lo realiza en su propia casa, ubicada en la comunidad de Samaniato. Con el crédito solicitado comprará sacos de arroz, azúcar, detergentes y golosinas. El anhela en un futuro próximo mejorar su tienda de abarrotes, con la finalidad de que le dé un formato distinto a sus demás competencias y de esa manera mantener a sus clientes teniendo los productos necesarios. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está conforme con su banco comunal, ya que todos cumplen con sus compromisos de pago. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrá comprar más productos de abarrotes para incrementar en su tienda.
texts.en:
Richard, 27, is a hardworking, responsible man living in his own house with his wife, Raquel, 26, and their three children who are the motivating factors behind his efforts to stand out in the future.  

Ten years ago Richard and his wife started working their own fields but they wanted wellbeing for their children so used their savings to open their own grocery store.  

Today, they feel very happy because they’ve reached one of their main objectives which is producing good economic results due to the quality and variety of products he offers his clientele.  Normally they work alone but sometimes their children help out.  His sales point is his own house located in the community of Samaniato.

He will use the requested loan to buy sacks of rice, sugar, detergent and snacks.  He hopes in future to improve his grocery store so that he can give it a different format from the competition so that he can keep his clientele by having the necessary products in stock.

This will be MFP loan #1 which he commits to repay according to the payment schedule.  He’s satisfied with his communal bank because everyone makes their payments.  He will use the 1500 new soles to buy more grocery items to increase the stock in his store.

loans.use: to buy staple items to stock his store.

loans.name: Yanett Del Pilar

texts.es: La socia continua tejiendo chompas, chalinas, gorras, guantes, escarpines, entre otras prendas, la socia vende esto en un local alquilado y aún le falta ahorrar un poco para poder comprar un stand propio de tal manera que pueda ahorrar el alquiler y tener mas ingresos, la socia requiere en esta ocasión el prestamo para invertir en la compra de lanas para la realización de sus prendas.
texts.en: This borrower is still knitting sweaters, shawls, hats, gloves, leg-warmers, and other articles of clothing. She sells these items from a rented spot and she only needs to save a little more money to be able to buy her own stand. That way she will save money by not paying rent and will have more income. She needs a loan to purchase wool to make the clothing.

loans.use: buy wool to make articles of  clothing

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel de 34 años de edad es un hombre responsable y trabajador; vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Antonia de 34 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, quienes son la razón de todos sus esfuerzos. Samuel, se esmera por dar lo mejor de si mismo y ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a su familia, por lo cual trabaja arduamente sus tierras cultivados con plantas de cacao y café. Samuel  es conocedor del arduo trabajo que se realiza en el campo, donde viene trabajando 25 años en sus propias tierras. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los productos recolectados hasta cierto tramo para luego ser transportados de manera artesanal. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo, porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias, cuenta que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque son meses donde abundan mayor cantidad de insectos perjudicando a sus sembríos. Este es su préstamo número 01 con MFP, Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo  para poder cumplir sus objetivos y por lo cual esta llano en cumplir con el pago de su préstamo puntualmente. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará  sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras y posteriormente volverlas productivas.
texts.en:
Samuel, 34, is a responsible, hardworking man living in his own house with his wife, Antonia, 34, and their three beloved children who are the reason behind all his efforts.

Samuel strives to give the best of himself and offer his family a good quality of life which is why he works hard in his cocoa bean and coffee fields.  Samuel is well aware of the hard work working in the fields entails since he’s been working his own land for 25 years.  During harvest time his children help him and day laborers are in charge of harvesting and transporting the picked beans a certain distance to then be transported in an artisanal way.  He feels very committed to his work because thanks to his daily effort today he enjoys seeing that his plants bear fruit leading to good profits.  He comments that winter is not pleasing to him because these are the months when insects abound that damage crops.

This is MFP loan #1 and he hopes this small loan will help him reach his objectives and he’s determined to make his payments punctually.  He will use the 1500 new soles to buy sacks of manure to fertilize his land to make them productive later on.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Liz Yocelin

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de golosinas pero ahora tambien tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor para implementar su tienda de abarrotes.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This borrower is still working in the business of selling sweets but now she also has a grocery store where she sells basic merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She works from 7:00 am until 10:00 pm and she wants her business to help her get ahead. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is asking for a loan to buy products like rice, sugar, milk, and oil in bulk to stock her store. She is happy about the loan and committed to repaying it on time.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, milk, oil and other products in bulk for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is single and sells waakye (rice and beans cooked together). She serves it with gari (a grain made from grated cassava), macaroni, meat, and fish stew. Mariama has been selling waakye for three years now. She uses her income to pay her accommodation bill.  

Mariama needs this loan to purchase bags of rice, beans, and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans, and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace operates  a  chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold) which she has done for 10 years. The dishes  she  serves are meat  soup, fish soup,  and rice balls. She is married to a farmer and has 6 dependents.   Grace uses her income to help her husband to pay their children’s  school fees. She will use her loan to purchase bush meat and other ingredients to prepare  food for sale. With the new profit, Grace  plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase bush meat and other ingredients to prepare  food for sale.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina  cooks "banku" (fermented maize dough) for sale; she serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce at Adum Banso near Takoradi. She is married to a farmer and has four children.  Faustina has done this for three years.  She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their accommodation bills. Her loan will be used to  purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses to prepare her "banku" for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a better stall for the sale of her cooked "banku" and fish.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her "banku" for sale

loans.name: Mi Dulce Hogar (Manta) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mi Dulce Hogar que está formado por 13 socias y 2 socios se reúne cada 15 días en Las Cumbres en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace un tiempo  atrás y formar este Banco Comunal el cual les ha servido de mucho para aumentar sus negocios. Por eso han solicitado un nuevo crédito, el otro crédito que recibieron de parte de la institución los beneficio mucho ya que aumentaron sus negocios y también mejoro su situación tanto económica como familiar,  en los pagos estuvieron muy bien y solo dos personas tuvieron algunos atrasos pero luego se pusieron al dia en los pagos, en si el crédito fue muy bueno y por esos están repitiendo el crédito con la institución.

La señora Rosario forma parte de este banco y está muy contenta de pertenecer hace tres ciclos.  Ella tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 14, 12 y 8 años de edad los mismos que estudian dos en colegio y  el menor en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual se dedica a la  venta de frutas y legumbres, él todos los días desde la madrugada se desplaza hasta el mercado de mayoristas de Manta para abastecerse de estos productos, luego se dedica a sus ventas por toda la ciudad la misma que recorre en un triciclo de su propiedad, ya tiene definidas las zonas por las que él vende y  tiene muchos clientes. Lleva 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para realizar sus ventas.

La foto pequeña adjunta se dé un socio y dos socias que por motivos del trabajo no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo. Los tres niños de la foto son hijos de dos de las socias.
texts.en:
The Mi Dulce Hogar (My Sweet Home) Community Bank is formed of 13 women and 2 men who meet every other week in Las Cumbres in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular throughout the whole year, and also for being a city with unmatched beauty and a lot of tourist attractions.

This is a group of people who decided to get together some time ago to form this community bank, which has greatly helped them grow their businesses. For this reason they have requested a new loan. The other loan they received from the institution benefited them greatly as it helped expand their businesses and also improved their lives, both financially and within their families. They were responsible with the payments and only two people fell behind but later got caught up with their payments. The loan was very good for them and so they are borrowing again from the institution.

Mrs. Rosario is part of this bank and she has happily belonged for three loan cycles. She is 35 years old and in a common-law marriage. She has three children who are 14, 12, and 8 years old and they are students-two in high school and the youngest in primary school. He husband works in sales.

She will use the loan for her husband's business selling fruits and vegetables. Every day he gets up very early to go to the Manta wholesale market to buy his produce. He then works selling all over the city on his own tricycle. He already has certain zones where he sells and he has a lot of customers. He has been doing this work for 7 years and it is going very well for him.

This loan is for buying fruits and vegetables. Her dream is to buy a car for the sales.

The small attached photo is of one man and two women who, for reasons of work, could not be present when the group photo was taken. The three children in the photo are children of two of the women.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Harth De Parquer Group

texts.es:
Blanca, es integrante del grupo de Harth de Parquer. Sus compañeras de crédito la invitaron a formar parte del grupo con la intención de impulsarla a invertir en lo que poco a poco se esta volviendo su negocio. Ella empezó a hacer comidas esporádicamente, según la iban recomendando,  para eventos especiales, como cumpleaños, aniversarios, entre otros. Entonces, solicitaba apoyo a sus vecinas pidiéndoles ollas y vasijas para poder cumplir con los pedidos. Esas mismas vecinas la motivaron para que se animara a invertir en ollas y vasijas y que lo viera como instrumentos de trabajo que cada vez utiliza con más frecuencia.
Estos consejos y analizar el crecimiento en sus pedidos, la llevaron a tomar la decisión de invertir y ser parte de este grupo y con ello crecer lo que ahora llama negocio propio.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the group Harth de Parquer. Her credit partners invited her to form part of the group with the intent to encourage her to invest in what, little by little, was becoming her business. She began to make food sporadically, based on recommendations,  for special events, like birthdays and anniversaries, among others. Then she solicited support from her neighbors, asking them for pots and vessels to be able to meet the requests. These same neighbors motivated her so that she was encouraged to invest in pots and vessels so that she would see them as instruments for her job that she uses more frequently each time. 

These tips, and the analysis of the increase in her business, led her to make the decision to invest and to be part of this group and with it to grow what she now calls her own business.

loans.use: invest in pots and vessels for a food business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace   operates  a  chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold) which she has done for 10 years. The dishes  she  serves  are meat  soup, fish soup,  and rice balls. She is married to a farmer and has three children.   Grace uses her income to assist her husband to pay their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase  more meat and other ingredients to prepare  food for sale. With the new profit, Grace  plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase  more meat and other ingredients to prepare  food for sale.

loans.name: Begg Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Begg Fallou est créé depuis le 9 décembre 2010; il est composé de quinze femmes qui sont voisines, elles sont animées par un sentiment de solidarité, de confiance et ont la possibilité de se réunir à chaque fois avant chaque rencontre mensuelle. Serigne Fallou est leur idole raison pour laquelle son nom est donné au groupe.
La responsable Khady est âgée de 28 ans, elle est célibataire sans enfant; elle est couturière et fait de la teinture parallèlement; elle a une bonne expérience de 6 ans.Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en tissu carrelé jaune marron et a croisé les mains sur sa poitrine.
Elle achète ses tissus dans la ville voisine coud et vend à domicile. 

Elle souhaite avec son prêt renforcer ses activités de couture et teinture pour pouvoir se faire beaucoup de bénéfices.

Elle veut élargir son champ d'action afin de mieux réaliser une épargne plus consistante et gérer sa famille à l'avenir.
texts.en:
The Begg Fallou solidarity group was started on December 9th, 2010; it is comprised of fifteen women who are neighbours. They are driven by a feeling of solidarity, of trust, and they have the possibility to meet any time prior to each monthly gathering. Serigne Fallou is their idol—the reason for which his name was given to the group.

The leader, Khady, is 28 years old, she is unmarried and has no children; she is a seamstress and handles colouration at the same time; she has a good six years of experience. She is standing at the right of the photo dressed in the yellow and brown square-patterned fabric with her hands crossed on her chest. She purchases fabric in the neighbouring town, then sews and sells back at at home.

With a loan, she hopes to strengthen her sewing and dying business so as to be able to earn large profits.

She wants to grow the scope of her business in order to better realise a more consistent level of savings and take care of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase dressmaking and dying supplies.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia  sells maize porridge; she serves the porridge with bread at Abrafo near Takoradi.  She is married to a driver and has four children.  Cecilia has been selling maize porridge for four years now. She is uses her income to help her husband to feed and  clothe their children.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her porridge and bread for sale. With the new profit, Cecilia will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her porridge and bread for sale

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo is fifty-five years of age and is married with four children.

Malo owns & operates a business venture selling baked goods in the local community.  She has three years of experience in this business.    Malo needs a loan of WST $2,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Malo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Malo's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles Mbogo is a 22-year-old matatu (privately opened minibus) operator in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. He is single and has been operating this business for the past three years. He is doing great. Charles was introduced to Kiva partner KADET and this is his second loan to finance his business. He plans to purchase spare parts for his matatu and use the anticipated profits to buy another vehicle. He plans to own several matatus in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his matatu.

loans.name: Lonise

texts.en:
Lonise is seventy-nine years of age and is a widow with eight children.

Lonise owns & operates a business venture, providing clothing alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Lonise needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2011, Lonise joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lonise's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials.

loans.name: Rossmery

texts.es:
La socia se sig8e dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes,gallinas y chanchos,la socia los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes,gallinas y chanchos y alimentos para los animales.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rossmerey continues to dedicate herself to raising animals such as guinea pigs, hens, and pigs. She raises and fattens them and then sells them in the different fairs that exist in the district of Anta. Rossmery works at her business from 7:00 am until 6:00 pm. She is advancing her children's wellbeing. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her animals. 

Rossmery is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs, hens, and pigs, and feed for her animals. She is happy about the loan and promises to comply with the schedule of payments.

loans.use: buy guinea pigs, hens, and pigs, and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is sixty-four years of age and is married with five children.

Pauline owns & operates a business venture selling fried foods in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business.    Pauline needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Pauline joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Pauline's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment & tools to expand her business.

loans.name: La Santa Cruz Group

texts.es:
Margarita cuenta con 35 años de edad, es casada tiene 5 hijos los cuales están estudiando Luis el mayor esta en 2° se prepa, Tania esta en 1° de prepa, miguel en 2° de secundaria, lucero en 4° de primaria y Jesús en 2° de primaria su esposo se llama José Luis es campesino.

Ella es comerciante tiene la venta de abarrotes tiene una tienda la cual aun no tiene nombre, lo cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los productos de abarrotes como son: aceites, galletas, leches, huevos, etc. Ella espera que le vaya muy bien con su préstamo y su negocio ya que le esta funcionando muy bien lo sabido sacar adelante.

Margarita pertenece al grupo la santa cruz cuyo nombre es por la colonia  Donde viven el grupo esta integrado por 11 mujeres muy trabajadoras a continuación serán mencionadas: Ma de Jesús, Sonia, Lorenza, Nicolasa, Ma Félix, Elizabeth, Obdulia, Saida, Tania, Luz Divina, Todas Realizan una actividad comercial como son: venta de refrescos, comida, ropa, quesos, perfumes, domésticos, abarrotes, etc.

*la señora Ma Felix no se alcanza a ver en la foto, por eso ha sido marcada como si no estuviera
texts.en:
Margarita is 35 years old and is married with 5 children who are studying in school. Luis, the oldest, is in the second year of high school, Tania is in the first year of high school, Miguel is in the second year of middle school, Lucero is in the fourth year of elementary school and Jesús is in the second year of elementary school. Her husband who is a farmer is named José Luis.

She is a merchant who sells groceries. She has a store which still has no name, in which she will invest her loan in the purchase of grocery products, such as: oils, cookies, milks, eggs, etc. She hopes that all goes very well with her loan and her business and as it is works very well she will be able to move it forward. 

Margarita belongs to the group Santa Cruz which is named after the suburb where this group lives that is composed of 11 hard working women that will be listed below: Ma de Jesus, Sonia, Lorenza, Nicolasa, Ma Félix, Elizabeth, Obdulia, Saida, Tania, Luz Divina. All of them work on a commercial activity, such as: the sale of soft drinks, food, clothing, cheeses, perfumes, domestics, groceries, etc.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of grocery products such as:oils, cookies, milks, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Kaps.  He is engaged in raising livestock.  The village of Kaps is favorable for this type of agricultural activity.  Samvel is married with three children: two daughters (eight and fifteen years old) and a nine-year-old son.  He also supports his brother’s family with produce grown on the family farm.  Samvel would like a loan to purchase additional livestock.  According to his business plan, this investment will increase the family income by 20 percent.  He will use some of the additional income to save for his children’s education.


About the Field Partner – AREGAK Universal Credit Organization
In the fall of 1997, United Methodist Committee on Relief (UMCOR) established the AREGAK microfinance program, with the purpose to create economic opportunities for low income people who have no or limited access to the formal financial sources, especially in the remote rural areas. The microfinance program rapidly became one of the largest MFI in Armenia in terms of number of active clients and portfolio size.

In March of 2006, AREGAK UCO was registered as a Universal Credit Organization, structured as a Closed Joint Stock Company with UMCOR as the sole shareholder.
Today, AREGAK UCO provides a broad range of financial services to the population without compromising the social aspects of its mission and continues initiatives geared toward the fulfillment of its ethical principles

Vision Statement
To be the most dynamic and ethical financial institution in Armenia and Nagorno Karabagh.

Mission Statement
AREGAK supports the economic development of small and medium entrepreneurs with high quality, accessible and reliable financial services.

AREGAK UCO’s Ethical Principles
1. Integrity and Excellence
We deliver on our promises
We are honest and transparent in everything we do
We provide excellent customer service
2. Respect and Inclusion
Our leadership, workforce and decision-making reflect and respect the diversity of customers and communities we serve.
We value all employees, investing in their personal and professional growth.
3. Innovation
We develop new processes and systems to improve efficiency
We create value added new products to enhance economic opportunities

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ruth Marina

texts.es: La socia Ruth continua trabajando en la misma Institución privada; ella tambien continua con su negocio alternativo y continua criando animales menores, la socia tiene cuyes y en esta ocasión ella desea invertir el prestamo enla compra de 200 cuyes para incrementar el numero de sus cuyes.
texts.en: Our partner Ruth goes on working for the same private institution. She also goes on with her alternative business and continues breeding small livestock, she has guinea pigs and in this occasion, she wants to invest the loan in buying 200 guinea pigs to increase the number of guinea pigs she owns.

loans.use: making an investment in 200 guinea pigs to increase the number of guinea pigs she owns.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.en:
Maria Rosa is twenty-three years of age and is married with three children.

Maria Rosa is starting a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.    She needs a loan of WST $2,000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Maria Rosa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Maria Rosa's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 63 years old and married with seven children.

Lucena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Lucena has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 40 years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading.

Lucena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Jom créé depuis le 9 décembre 2010 est composé d'un total de quatorze femmes qui sont issues d'une même famille et sont solidaires entre elles comme l'indique le nom qu'elles ont choisi.Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Coumba la responsable est âgée de 42 ans; elle est mariée mère de quatre enfants. Elle mène une activité de commerce de riz au marché central de la ville avec une expérience moyenne de 3 ans. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en blanc et a levé la main gauche.
Elle se ravitaille au marché auprès des grossistes et revend à ses clients sur place.

Son prêt lui servira à acheter du riz en grande quantité pour ainsi se faire plus de revenus.


Elle aide son mari dans les dépenses de la famille et souhaite avoir sa propre boutique afin d'acheter des quantités significatives de riz.
texts.en:
The Bokk Jom solidarity group was created on Dec. 9th 2010 and is comprised of a total of fourteen women who come from the same family and stand together—as indicated by the name they have chosen.

Coumba, the leader, is 42 years old; she is a married mother of four children.  She runs a business trading rice in the town’s central market, and has had a decent experience for three years now. She is pictured standing on the right of the photo dressed in white and raising her left hand.

She stocks-up on fresh supplies at the wholesalers’ market, and then resells to her clients on-site.

Her loan would be used to purchase rice in large quantities in order to generate more profits.

She helps her husband with the family expenses, and wishes to have her own storefront so she can buy significant quantities of rice.

loans.use: to purchase rice for resale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old.  She is married and has 7 children.  Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.  Josephine aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her 3 children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 63 years old.  She is married and has one child.  Letecia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Letecia has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending. Letecia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lydian

texts.en:
Lydian is forty years of age and is married with four children.

Lydian owns & operates a business venture selling baked goods in the local community.  She has four years of experience in this business.    Lydian needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Lydian joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lydian's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Genny

texts.en:
Genny is 47 years old and married with six children.

Genny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Genny has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from networking for MSE and Natasia.

Genny aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Federita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Federita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Federita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing/fish vending business.

Federita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is married with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Eva is 65 years old and has one child who is in school.

Eva has a coffee shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase mugs, coffee, tables and chairs for her business.

Eva has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Eva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase mugs, coffee, tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell in her stall.  Concepcion has been in this business for 15 years. Concepcion earns additional income from a general store.

Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: El Castillo Group

texts.es:
El grupo lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Nelly de 49 años ella se dedica al comercio de comida los fines de sema y diario vende tortillas, bastimento de preferencia de los nicaragüenses. El crédito lo invertirá en productos en especial maíz, leña, hueso, carne…etc.

Las otras integrantes son Norma de 41años quien vende ropa y Marvely quien también se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 4años.
texts.en:
The group is composed of three working women entrepreneurs, one of them is Maria Nelly who is 49 years old. She works selling food on the weekends and daily sells tortillas, the staple of preference for Nicaraguans. She will invest the loan in products, especially corn, wood, bone, meat, etc.

The other members are Norma who is 41 years old, who sells clothes and Marvely who has also worked selling clothes for 4 years.

loans.use:
to buy corn,  wood, bone, meat, etc.
comprar maíz, leña, hueso, carne…etc.

loans.name: David Gaudencio

texts.es: El socio David continua trabajando vendiendo churros y atendiendo junto a sus conyugue, el esta en la foto junto con ella, ambos trabajan en la preparacion y elaboracion de los deliciosos churros; el socio desea seguir unos años mas trabajando arduamente para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida, el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito en la compra de harina, mantequilla, miel, manjar y otros ingredientes como azucar impalpable para espolvorear los churros.
texts.en: Our partner David goes on selling the snacks known as ‘churros’ and working together with his wife. He is in the photo with her. Both work preparing and elaborating the delicious churros. Our partner wishes to go on working hard for some more years to help getting his children ahead in life and improve their quality of life. Our partner wants in this occasion to invest the loan in buying flour, butter, honey, and ‘manjar’ (a milk based sweet that can be used to fill pastries or as a spread) and other ingredients like powdered sugar to sprinkle over the churros.

loans.use: buying flour, butter, honey, and ‘manjar’ (a milk based sweet that can be used to fill pastries or as a spread) and other ingredients like powdered sugar to sprinkle over the churros.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 76 years old and a widow with three children. Anita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Anita has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles and other miscellaneous items. Anita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net, paint and other equipment for her fishing business.

Belinda has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from her general store.

Belinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to buy an additional fishing boat in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, paint and other equipment.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: Isidro, natural de la ciudad de Kimbiri, de 48 años de edad, es un hombre alegre y  trabajador; vive en su casa propia junto a sus 02 queridos hijos, a quienes les brinda una adecuada educación. Isidro es un hombre muy responsable y de actitud muy alegre, trabaja sus tierras con mucho empeño para sacar adelante su producción,  especialmente siembra cacao y café plantas que mayormente pertenecen en la zona del Valle Río Apurimac. Asimismo nos comenta que gracias a la perseverancia  y entusiasmo de trabajar puede obtener buenas cosechas. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que después de tanto esfuerzo puede tener un buen producto. Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo mas difícil es tener que cargar los sacos de su cosecha hasta los centros de acopio donde los llega a vender a un buen precio por la buena calidad de sus productos. Este es su crédito número 01 con MFP, se siente muy contento de saber que contará con el apoyo de los financistas; ya que de esa manera podrá seguir con sus planes de trabajo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar una moto carguero para que pueda llevar sus sacos de cosecha con mucha facilidad.
texts.en: Isidro, 48,  a native of Kimbiri,  is a cheerful and hardworking man who lives in his own home together with his two dear children who he makes sure  have enough schooling.  Isidro is a very responsible man with a sunny disposition who works his fields with great effort to produce good crops. He principally plants cacao and coffee that are mainly from the Valle Rio Apurimac zone.  He tells us that thanks to the perseverance and enthusiasm he has in working, his harvests are successful.  What he likes most about his work is that after so much effort he can have good results.  He has been in this work for 30 years and what he considers the most difficult is transporting the sacks of his crops to the distribution centers that he uses to get a good price for the good quality of his crops.  This is his first loan with MFP.  He feels very pleased to know that he will find support from the financiers and this way he can continue with his business plans.  He will use the 3000 new sols to buy a cargo motorcycle so that he can transport his sacks of produce more easily.

loans.use: to buy a cargo motorcycle

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 45 years old and married with seven children.

Glenda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries.

Glenda has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from raising livestock and rice retailing.

Glenda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 37 years old, married and has five children, with two children in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lucia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like bamboo, binders and other equipment.

Lucia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like bamboo, binders and other equipment.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers. She has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Rowena would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es:
Carlos Luis tiene 60 años de edad y vive con su familia en la comunidad de Santa Teresita, en la provincia de Cartago. La Ciudad de Cartago fue fundada en 1563 por el conquistador español Juan Vázquez de Coronado, fungió como capital de Costa Rica hasta 1823 y fue sede de la primera corte internacional permanente de la historia mundial, la Corte de Cartago. Su relieve montañoso está formado por dos cordilleras: la Central y la cordillera de Talamanca.

Carlos Luis tiene la motivación y la ayuda de sus familiares, lo cual le facilita seguir con su vida y su trabajo. Además  le es muy importante hacer este cambio en su local, ya que la demanda es cada vez más fuerte y los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Carlos Luis es un micro crédito de ¢600,000 (seiscientos mil colones), para comprar materiales de construcción para el arreglo de su lugar de trabajo, y para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su negocio.

Carlos Luis forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito y dice que con esto espera poder seguir creciendo como microempresario y sacar su negocio adelante. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Carlos Luis is 60 years old and lives with his family in the community of Santa Teresita, Cartago province. The city of Cartago was founded in 1563 by the Spanish conquistador Juan Vazquez de Coronado. It served as capital of Costa Rica until 1823, and was the seat of the first Permanent International Court in the history of the world, the Cartago Court. It's mountainous landscape is formed by two mountain chains: the Central and the Talamanca cordilleras. 

Carlos Luis has the motivation and the aid of his family members, and that helps him continue with his life and his work. In addition, it is very important to make changes in his store, since demand is ever stronger and the residents of the community have been satisfied with the services he offers.

What Carlos Luis requests at this moment is a micro-loan of 600,000 colons to buy construction materials for improvements in his place of work, and to provide better maintenance and possible assistance for his business.

Carlos Luis is a part of the “Empresa de Credito Comunal (Communal Credit Enterprise) de El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba,” one of the 150 organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his 1st loan and he says that with this he hopes to be able to continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur  and advance his business. Also, he points out that thanks to these types of organizations and means of financing loans, borrowers can dedicate more time to productive activities.

loans.use: to expand his soda shop/restaurant.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela de treinta años de edad vive con su madre y su hija, ella posee una pupuseria en el lugar de su residencia, últimamente ha tenido mucha clientela pues sus pupusas son exquisitas, hechas con material de excelente calidad y a precios bajos, además las personas quedan satisfechas porque el servicio es muy bueno; Blanca es una mujer dedicada a su labor y le gusta estar adelante de su competencia, piensa que la vida es un sueño y hay que alcanzarlo, está completamente dispuesta es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, queso, chicharrón, maíz entre otros. Blanca Estela tiene fe que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Blanca Estela is 30 years old and lives with her mom and her daughter. She has a pupusa stall located in her home. Lately she has had many customers because her pupusas are exquisite, made from excellent quality ingredients and at low prices, moreover, these persons remain satisfied because the service is very good. Blanca is a woman who is dedicated to her work and she likes to stay ahead of her competition. She thinks that life is a dream and one has to seize it. She is very ready to do so and for this reason she solicited Integral for a loan that permits her to buy basic grains, cheese, pork and corn, among other items. Blanca Estela has faith that through this she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, cheese, pork and corn.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Mercedes works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising hogs. Mercedes is borrowing 50,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Mercedes has been sustaining her business activities with her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream – to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ninoska

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de compra y de licores; la socia compra y almacena licores de calidad para exhibirlos y vender al publico en general, la socia desea invertir en la compra de licores en general, la socia ha hecho el pedido de los licores que desea para implementar su tienda y espera que lelgue en una semana, para lo cual ella desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de la primera carga de mercadería de licores.
texts.en: The partner continues with her business purchasing liquors; the partner buys and stores quality liquors to display them and to sell them to the public in general. The partner seeks to invest in the purchase of liquors in general, she has made the order for the liquors that she seeks to place in her store and she hopes that they arrive in a week. She seeks to invest the loan in the purchase of the first order of liquor merchandise.

loans.use: to invest the loan in the purchase of the first order of liquor merchandise

loans.name: Renee

texts.es: Renee, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, es una mujer muy trabajadora de 23 años de edad; vive en casa alquilada junto a su esposo Amílcar de 26 años y su pequeño hijo Marco de 04 años a quienes brindan amor y desean un buen bienestar. Renee es una joven madre muy dedicada a su trabajo y su familia, comenta que desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura ya que ahora que a formado su hogar tiene que trabajar arduamente para poder educar a su pequeño hijo. Hace 06 meses empezó a criar gallinas en su chacra para luego venderlas a buen precio y así solventar con los gastos de su hogar. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que lo puede realizar con mucha facilidad sin descuidar a su hijo, mientras que con la ayuda de su esposo puede ver los trabajos de cultivo. Para Renee no hay nada mas importante que salir adelante vendiendo sus gallinas ya que la gente de su localidad consumen gallinas criadas en la chacra ya que son buenas por la manera en como se alimentan de forma natural. Este es su crédito número 01 con MFP, se siente muy contenta por el apoyo brindado ya que de esa manera puede seguir con su objetivo de trabajo; asimismo se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas de pago. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrá comprar maíz para la alimentación de sus gallinas.
texts.en:
Renee, a native of the city of Santa Rosa, is a very hardworking 23-year-old woman.  She lives in a rented house with her husband Amílcar, 26, and her little boy Marco, 4, whom they love and for whom they want well-being.  Renee is a young mother who is very dedicated to her work and her family.  She says that since she was young her parents taught her to work in agriculture.

Now that she has formed her home she has to work hard to be able to raise her small child.  Six months ago she began to raise chickens on her farm, to later sell them at a good price, to pay for the household expenses.  What she likes most about her job is that she is able to do it easily without ignoring her son, and at the same time she can see to the crops with the help of her husband.

For Renee there is nothing more important than getting ahead selling her chickens because the people of her area eat farm-raised chickens, which are good because of how they are fed naturally.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy about the help offered because in this way she can continue with her work goal.  Also, she promises to make her payments punctually.

With the 1,500 PEN she will be able to buy corn to feed her chickens.

loans.use: to buy corn to feed the chickens.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor, vive con su esposo y un hijo, ella es comerciante de ropa, aprendió el negocio por su familia, ya que su madre inicio con el negocio y por consiguiente ella lo aprendió.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para surtir el negocio, como la ropa con nuevos estilos, blusas, camisas, faldas, vestidos, para mejorar el negocio y ofrecer a los clientes nuevos productos.
La aspiración de Flor es que a través del préstamo logre mejorar la capacidad de respuesta a los clientes, en un futuro quiere tener un local propio donde ofrecer los productos.
texts.en:
Flor lives with her husband and child. She is a clothing merchant and learned this trade from her family. Since her mother started this business, Flor was able continue her knowledge of this trade.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to restock her business. This includes new styles of clothing that consists of blouses, shirts, skirts, and dresses so that she can improve her business and offer new products to her customers. Flor’s aspiration for this loan is to improve her capacity to respond to her customers. In the future, she wants to have her own shop where she can offer her products.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, skirts, and dresses.

loans.name: Yulissa Karina

texts.es:
Yulissa una mujer de 32 años, tiene 4 pequeños, a los cuales cuida y vela por su bienestar diario junto a su esposo, el mismo que trabaja día a día en una moto taxi alquilada. Yulissa también trabaja, ella labora en un laboratorio clínico aproximadamente 7 horas diarias. Básicamente ella y su familia dependen de la moto taxi que conduce su esposo, pero lamentablemente es alquilada y no está generando los ingresos que debería diariamente. 

Yulissa y su familia viven en Ica, Perú, ciudad aclamada por los iqueños como la “Tierra del Sol”, famosa por la constante presencia del sol en todos los meses del año y el alto nivel de calor que se percibe en sus calles, no solo climático sino también de su gente. A lo largo de estos últimos 5 años, esta ciudad ha sido testigo del incremento de las inversiones por parte de las empresas privadas, las mismas que han generado gran cantidad de puestos de trabajo y desde luego el desarrollo profesional de los mismos, en este nuevo y mejorado Ica vive y trabaja la señora Yulissa.

Con ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Yulissa podrá comprar junto a su esposo una moto taxi propia y generar los ingresos que en realidad necesita, también a planeado juntar el dinero necesario para invertirlo en la compra de un automóvil, el mismo que generará muchos más ingresos, esta familia tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y está dispuesta a darlo todo por lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Yulissa is a 32-year-old woman with four young children whom she cares for and watches along with her husband, who works every day in a rented motorcycle taxi.  Yulissa also works, in a clinical laboratory approximately seven hours a day.  Basically she and her family depend on the motorcycle taxi that her husband drives, buy unfortunately it is rented and he is not generating the daily income that he should be.

Yulissa and her family live in Ica, Peru, a city acclaimed by residents as the "Land of the Sun," famous for the constant presence of the sun in all the months of the year and for the high level of warmth in the streets, not only climatic but also from the people.  In these last five years, this city has witnessed an increase in investment from private companies, which have generated a large number of jobs and, of course, professional development.  Yulissa lives in this new and improved Ica.

With the help of Kiva lenders, Yulissa and her husband will be able to buy her own motorcycle taxi with her husband and generate the income that she really needs.  She also has planned to get together the necessary money to invest in buying a car, which also will generate much more income.

This family very much wants to get ahead and is willing to give it their all to achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy her own motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Mboolo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de solidarité Mboolo a été créé le 28 décembre 2011.Il est composé de 21 femmes issues de la même localité elles se sont unies par affinité, par amitié. Elles exercent la même activité de petit commerce. Fama debout à droite sur la photo  est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle fait le commerce de couscous. Avec son prêt reçu, elle va augmenter son approvisionnement en mil pour transformer et vendre le couscous. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en: The Mboolo solidarity group has been created on December 28, 2011. It is composed of 21 women from the same area who organized a group together  based on friendship and affinity. They all work as vendors. Fama, standing on the right in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is 36 years old. She is married and the mother of two. She sells couscous. With her loan she is going to expand her stock of millet, which she uses to prepare couscous for sale. Her revenues will allow her to help her husband support the family.

loans.use: to buy millet for the preparation of couscous for sale

loans.name: Haide

texts.en: Haide is 34 years old and married with three children. Haide works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. Haide has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 4 years and also earns an income from a networking business of dry goods. Haide aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Gladys Del Rosario

texts.es: Gladys de 39 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, uno estudiando la primaria y el otro estudiando la universidad, labora para el MINED desde hace 19 años como deocente en el Colegio Floresmilda. Esta solicitando su 5to credito con el objetivo de mejorar el porche de su casa y ademas terminar de acondicionar su cuarto, pues desea embaldozarlos, para asi brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Gladys, who is 39 years old, is single. She has two children, one who is in primary school and one who attends the university. She has been working for MINED for 19 years as a teacher at the Floresmilda school. She is applying for her 5th loan with the goal of improving the porch of her house and also to fix up a room, since she wants to tile it to thus offer her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to improve the porch and a room

loans.name: Cerfuna

texts.en:
As quoted by Napoleon Hill, "if you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way." Ms. Cerfuna has the strong determination to achieve her desire. She is married, residing at Tituron, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental and blessed with two children.

Ms. Cerfuna is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She borrowed money from Paglaum MPC for the purpose of purchasing a motorcycle. 

Ms. Cerfuna says that the best way to predict the future is to create it.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura, de 45 años, es una mujer muy alegre, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Renán de 41 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad. Maura, es una mujer de lucro se dedica con mucho esmero a labrar la tierra para luego cultivar plantas de cacao, actividad que realiza hace mas de 35 años. Además de dedicarse al cuidado de sus padres ya que son ancianos que necesitan atención. Maura con la ayuda de su pareja puede realizar los trabajos de su chacra porque gracias a ello pueden solventar los gastos de su familia. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y jornaleros; de ese modo puede extraer rápido los frutos para luego ofrecerla a las  asociaciones de  acopio ubicadas en su localidad. Sin embargo le resulta difícil transportar sus sacos de cosecha hasta los centros de acopio. Por otras parte lo que mas prioriza ahora es ampliar  sus campos de cultivo y de esa manera aumentar su producción y por último obtener una buena estabilidad económica. Este será su crédito numero 02 con MFP, se siente contenta de saber que obtendrá una vez mas el apoyo financiero; de la misma forma que se compromete a seguir pagando puntualmente sus cuotas.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Maura, who is 45 years old, is a very happy woman. She lives in her own house along with her partner, Renán, who is 41 years old, and their three beloved children, to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. Maura is a profit-making woman. She works with great conscientiousness to plow the land to then grow cacao plants, work that she has been doing for more than 35 years. She does this in addition to taking care of her parents, since they are elderly and need attention. Maura, with the help of her partner, can carry out this work on her farm because thanks to it, they can pay for the family expenses. At harvest time, she can count on the help of her children and day laborers. This way she can extract the fruits rapidly to then offer the harvest to the cooperatives in her district. Nevertheless, it is difficult for her to transport her sacks of harvested cacao to the cooperative centers. On the other hand, her priority now is to expand her fields of cultivation and in this way to increase her production and finally to obtain good economic stability. This will be her second loan with MFP. She feels happy to know that she will once again obtain financial support, in the same way that she promises to continue making her payments punctually.

With the 1000 PEN, she will buy cacao plants.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants

loans.name: İgbal

texts.ru: Iqbalu 25 let, on jenat I imeet godovalogo rebenka. Chtobi soderjat semyu on nachal zanimatsa torgovley produktov. Kogda on nachinal svoy biznes u nego bilo malo deneg, potom on obratilsa za svoim pervim kreditom v Vijn Fond AzerCredit I vzal dengi v 700 manat. On arenduet magazin gde i prodaet produkti vot uje 5 let. Iqbal vsegda nadeyetsa na svoi sili I planiruet rasshirit svoe delo I imet sobstvenniy magazine dla prodaji. Segodna emu nujen kredit v summe 1000 azn dla zakupki pishevix produktov I on ochen nadeetsa chto vi podderjite ego v ego celax.
texts.en: Igbal is 25 years old, married and has a one-year-old child.  In order to support his family, he became involved in selling products.  When he was first starting his business, he had very little money.  Then, he requested his first loan in the sum of 700 manat from the VisionFund AzerCredit.  Igbal leases a store, where he has been selling food products for five years.  He always relies on on his strength and plans to expand his business, and have his own store.  Today, Igbal needs a loan in the sum of 1000 AZN to purchase food products, and he hopes very much that you would support him in his business.

loans.use: to buy groceries for his store

loans.name: Wilson Alberto

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Unión y Trabajo se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a don Wilson, tiene 52 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tiene una hija de  5 años de edad, aunque de otra relación que tuvo el tiene 5 hijos que ya son mayores de edad, con el solo vive su hija más pequeña la misma que estudia en escuela. Su esposa es ama de casa.

Él tiene un negocio de venta de carne, el mismo que lo realiza de la siguiente manera,  se desplaza dos veces por semana a los centros de faenamiento de reses para comprar la mejor carne para luego limpiarla y enviarla a la ciudad de Quito,  reciben sus clientes los mismos que le realizan los pagos a través de su cuenta de ahorros,  nunca ha tenido ningún problema con este tipo de ventas ya que sus clientes son personas muy serias y cumplidas. Él lleva más de 10 años con su negocio y cada vez sus clientes le piden mayor cantidad de carne.

Este crédito es para comprar más carne para enviar a sus clientes. Lleva 8  ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para financiar su negocio. 

Su sueño es comprar un camioncito para llevar el mismo sus productos.
texts.en:
The Unión y Trabajo Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Manta, known for its lovely beaches that people visit throughout the year, and for being a city of unequaled beauty with lots of  tourists attractions.

Here we meet Wilson, fifty-two.  He's married with one five-year-old daughter, although he has five grown children from a prior relationship.  Now he has only the one daughter at home because she is in school.  He wife is a homemaker.

Wilson has a meat business: twice a week he goes to the slaughterhouse to buy the best meat to process and send to the city of Quito. His clients pay for their products directly into Wilson's savings account.  He has never had a problem doing business this way because his clients are very dutiful and serious people.  Wilson has been in business for more than ten years and his clients are ordering larger and larger quantities of meat all the time.

Wilson is seeking a loan to buy more meat to send his clients.  He's completed eight loan cycles with the communal and he likes it because the loans really help him fund his business.  

His dream is to buy a small truck so he can transport his own goods.

loans.use: to buy meats.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.ru: Leyla otkrila svoy torgoviy biznes I upravlaet im uje 10 let odna. Ey 53 goda, ona zamujem, u nee odin rebenok 19-ti let. Ee muj rabotaet rabochim I ego zarplati ne xvataet na semyu. Ona staraetsa pomogat emu soderjat semyu. Ona nachinala svoy biznes s malogo kapitala, 70 azn. Segodna Leyla prodaet odejdu I pridannoe za svoim prilavkom v magazine. Na segodnashniy den Leyle nujni 800 azn dla zakupki novix tovarov. Ona xochet rasshirit svoy biznes chtobi privlech novix klientov.
texts.en: Leyla opened her own retail business and has been running it alone for ten years.  She is 53 years old, married and has one 19 year-old child.  Her husband is a worker, and his salary is not enough for the family.  Leyla tries to help him to support the family.  She started her business with a small capital of 70 AZN.  Today, Leyla sells clothing and dowry behind the counter of her store.  Currently, Leyla needs 800 AZN to purchase new merchandise.  She wants to expand her business in order to attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for resale

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Fallou a été créé le 10/12/10.IL est composé de 11 membres issus du même village.Ndèye Fama est la responsable du groupe, elle est âgée de 47ans et a en charge 03 enfants. Elle a pour activité principale le petit commerce de condiments(ail, poivre , piment)etc.. Elle a une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité.Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en taille basse multicolore.
 Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandises pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Son objectif est d'élargir son commerce pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et assurer leur survie
texts.en:
The Sop Seringe Fallou solidarity group was created 10/12/10. It is composed of 11 members who come from the same village. 

Ndèye Fama is the leader of the group. She is 47 years old and supports three children.  Her primary activity is running a small business dealing in condiments (garlic, peppers, etc.).  She has had a good track record for this type of business. She is pictured standing at the right of the photo dressed in a multi-coloured taille basse.

This loan would allow her to stock up on merchandise that will satisfy her clientele.  Her objective is to expand her business so she can provide for the needs of her family and ensure their survival.

loans.use: to purchase condiments (peppers, garlic, bouillon).

loans.name: Esmaela

texts.en:
Esmaela is 60 years old, married, and has nine children. She lives in the Philippines. Esmaela has a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for seven years.

Esmaela is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will useto buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Esmaela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.l

loans.name: Yhasmany

texts.es: El socio Yhasmani; continua con su negocio distribuyendo cigarros al por mayor y menor a sus diferentes clientes, el socio esta a punto de culminar sus estudios superiores y trabajar en lo suyo, el socio desea en esta ocasion seguir apoyando a sus mama con el credito, el desea invertir el credito en la compra de cigarros al por mayor y seguir mejorando el negocio para que su mama pueda sentirse tranquila y distraida con sus actividades.
texts.en: Our partner Yhasmani goes on with his business, distributing cigarettes retail and wholesale to his diverse clients. He is about to finish his higher education and start working in his thing. Our partner wants in this occasion to use the loan to go on supporting his mother, he wishes to invest the loan in buying cigarettes wholesale and go on improving the business so that his mother can feel at peace and enjoy her activities.

loans.use: buying cigarettes wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
Jose Alberto tiene 49 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad de la provincia de Guanacaste. La economía de la zona de Guanacaste se fundamenta principalmente en la ganadería, aunque también en esta región se practican la apicultura y acuacultura.

Jose Alberto se dedica a la fabricación de artesanía desde hace diez años, lo cual le ha llevado el sustento diario a su familia y le ha dejado muchísima experiencia a la hora de hacer y diseñar sus piezas.  
Desde que  ingreso a este negocio los resultados han sido buenos, ya que ha tenido una gran aceptación por los vecinos de la comunidad. 

En estos momentos lo que desea Jose Alberto es solicitar un préstamo por ¢600,000(seiscientos mil colones) para asi invertir en materia prima para continuar produciendo estas piezas artesanales. Asi mismo, para que su negocio continúe incrementando.

Jose Alberto es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Guaitil S.A,  razón por la cual se siente  muy agradecida por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Jose Alberto, age 49, lives with his family in a community in the Guanacaste province.  The economy in the Guanacaste zone is mainly based on livestock.  However, bee-keeping and aquaculture are also carried out in this region.

Jose Alberto has been making handicrafts for ten years.  This has brought his family their daily bread, and it has left him with a great deal of experience making and designing his pieces.  Ever since he entered into this business the results have been good.   He has had great acceptance by his neighbors in the community.

Jose Alberto now wishes to request a loan for 600,000 colones to invest in raw material in order to continue producing these handicrafts.  He also wants the loan so that his business will continue increasing.

Jose Alberto is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Guaitil S.A.  He is very grateful to this group for the opportunities to access loans that are given to him.  He is also grateful to be able to carry out his life projects.

loans.use: to get materials to continue making his handicrafts.

loans.name: Alexei

texts.ru:
Алексей женат. Его супругу зовут Любовь. У них есть взрослый сын. Алексей депутат сельского совета и он имеет свой собственный бизнес.

Алесей выращивает ранние овощи на протяжении 30 лет. Имеет большой участок земли, четыре большие теплицы и теплицу для рассады. Он трудолюбивый, общительный, имеет большое желание развиваться.  Этот бизнес  является перспективным для  данного региона. И у Алексея есть тоже бизнес цели на будущее. Выращивание овощей- основной доход Алексея.

Алексей просит предоставить ему кредит на сумму 23,000 гривен  на постройку дополнительной теплицы, закупку пленки, семян и удобрений.
texts.en:
Alexei and his wife, Liubov', have an adult son.  Alexei is a deputy on the village council and he has his own business.

Alexei is hardworking, sociable, and he has a great desire for personal development.  Alexei has grown early vegetables for 30 years and this is his main source of income.  He has a large piece of land, four large greenhouses, and a greenhouse for starting seeds.  This is a promising business in his district.  Alexei also has future plans for his business. 

Alexei is asking to be given a loan of 23,000 hryven' (UAH) to build an additional greenhouse, and to buy plastic greenhouse film, seed, and fertilizer.

loans.use: to build an additional greenhouse, and to buy plastic greenhouse film, seed, and fertilizer

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a hairdresser and also sells cooking utensils and saucepans at Adum Benso. Eunice has been selling these for the past nine years.

Eunice has completed Junior High Senior.  She is married and has five children. Her husband works with the Benso Oil Plantation. She supports her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  

She will use her loan to purchase more cooking utensils and saucepans for sale.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her cooking utensils.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking utensils and saucepans for sale.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Los Girasoles” está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran peluquería, venta de ropa nueva, venta de ropa usada, preparación de comida rápida y jugos naturales. Perteneciente a la comuna de Colina.
María Teresa presidenta del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda, su cabello se encuentra tomado es de color castaño oscuro, usa una polera color morado, pantalones color negro. 
Se dedica atender un negocio con venta de abarrotes, verduras y alimento para mascotas. Desde hace un año, después de haberlo cerrado durante un tiempo para criar a uno de sus hijos.
