texts.en: Paul is a 36-year-old married man with six children living in Masindi, Uganda. For four years, he has been in the transport sector. He used to ride another person's motorcycle but after saving enough wages he bought his own. He dreams of owning at least six of them since the business then would have less risks. Paul needs the loan facility to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 38, is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Sally owns and operates a fishing business. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Sally joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Sally is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair the fishing boat to provide better services. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions and to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to repair the fishing boat to provide better services

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a 33-year-old single mother of a child living in Masindi, Uganda. For two years she has been farming and this has enabled her to provide the basics to her child. Her major challenge is the unpredictable seasonal weather variations and her dream is to venture into mechanized agriculture. Monica needs the loan facility so she can pay workers who are clearing her land for crop growing.

loans.use: to pay workers who are clearing her land for crop growing.

loans.name: Johnbosco

texts.en: Johnbosco needs the loan facility to buy maize and beans to sell. He is a hard-working young man with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. He used to be a bricklayer and after saving enough money he decided to venture into the produce trade. His challenge is inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand and his dream is to own a food store.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 50-year-old married woman with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. She has been operating a retail shop for 15 years and this has helped her to pay school fees for her children. She dreams of diversifying her business and venturing into the transport sector. Grace needs the loan facility to buy a motorcycle for her transportation business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Gorretti

texts.en: Gorretti is a 35-year-old married woman living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a drug shop that she started six years ago. She started as a farmer and later raised capital to open up a drug shop. She faces the challenges of high taxes and customers not paying on time. Gorretti has the dream of upgrading her shop and educating her children. She intends to use the loan to buy drugs for her drug shop.

loans.use: to buy drugs for her drug shop

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is 31 years old and is a married woman with three children aged 11, 9 and 1. She and her husband run a fishing business in Trinidad, Bohol. Cornelia's husband operates their fishing boat. She sells her husband's catch at the market. Cornelia also buys more fish from other fishermen to sell.

She has requested this loan to buy fishing nets and materials for fishing boat construction such as marine plywood and paint. Cornelia hopes that this loan will help improve their business. She hopes to earn more and to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and materials for fishing boat construction

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 28-year-old lady from Lambwe town, Western Kenya and is married to Moses. They have three children aged between six and 10 years.

Josephine operates a cereal selling business in Lambwe town, a business she has done for the last 10 years earning a monthly income of  Kes 15,000. 

She is taking out her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a stock of maize cereal for sale. Josephine will use her profits to pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to have better living standards and to continue accessing KADET loans.

loans.use: To buy a stock of maize cereal for sale.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 37-year-old married woman with seven children. Her oldest child is 16 years old.

Jennifer is engaged in fishing. Her husband, who is a fisherman, mainly operates their fishing boat. Jennifer sells his husband's catch at the market. They have had their fishing business for 15 years. Jennifer works hard to support her family. She plans to use her loan to buy more fishing nets and pay school fees.

In the future, Jennifer hopes to have a stable income and to have their children finish college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and pay school fees

loans.name: Amia

texts.en:
Amia, aged 54, is a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jaime, her business partner, and is mother to her children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Amia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.     

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 17,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Amia hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration there from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa, aged 45, is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is a single mother with two children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Nelfa maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are earning as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nelfa hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration there from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and orders for her customers.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a married woman with five children. The oldest child is 14 years old. Leonida's husband works as a farmer.

Leonida sells food items like bananas and camote (sweet potato) cue to her community. She also sells ready-to-wear clothes like men's and ladies' shirts and jeans. Leonida does her best to earn more and to help sustain her family. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as shirts and school supplies.

In the future, Leonida plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as shirts and school supplies.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
This is Rosalina, 44, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Jaime, her business partner, and father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosalina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 33,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Rosalina hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 54 years old and is married with six children.

Nida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (variety store) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Nida has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store (variety store) for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Nida aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Bernadetha

texts.en:
Bernadetha is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Bernadetha has a food shop, or carenderia, that sells viands like chicken pork adobo, afritada and caldereta. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands for sell.

Bernadetha has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Bernadetha hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands for sell.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Mirasol has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Mirasol has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Mirasol hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 36-year-old lady from Rodi in Homabay town West of Kenya and is married to James. They have six children, ages 3 to 15 years.

Mary operates a hotel business in Rodi, a business she has done for the last 10 years, making a monthly income of Kes 11,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy foodstuffs like sugar, cooking flour and rice. She will channel her profits back to the business.

Her dream is to have a stable and better life through KADET loaning.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like sugar, cooking flour and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wood.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Ruby has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Ruby has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Ruby hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is a 39-year-old man from the Makongeni area of Lambwe town, Western Kenya, and is married to Eunice. They have six children, ages 4 through 15.

Lucas operates a fish-selling business, a business he has done for the last six years, making a monthly income of Kes 12,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy stock of fish for sale. He will use the profits to educate his children.

His dream is to open other business outlets for fish selling in Lambwe town.

loans.use: to buy stock of fish for sale.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis, se dedica a vender productos medicinales, que son elaborados naturalmente, vive con su esposa y un hijo, él tiene tres meses de estar en el negocio de medicinas, pero tiene 12 años de estar vendiendo tortas y tacos, también hace trabajos de instalación de cable de televisión. 
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de un lote de medicinas de mega help, como suplementos alimenticios, tratamientos para subir o bajar de peso, este préstamo le ayudara para surtir el negocio y tal vez así pueda buscar nuevas zonas para ganar clientes. 
Su aspiración es mantener el negocio surtido y ganar experiencia, ya que es un ingreso más para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis earns a living selling natural medicine products and he lives with his wife and son.  He has been selling medicine for three months but has 12 years' experience selling tarts and tacos.  He also does television cable installation jobs.

He is requesting a loan to buy a batch of Mega Help medicines, including food supplements and weight loss and weight gain treatments.  The loan will help him stock his business so he can look for new areas to make new customers.  His goal is to keep his business stocked and gain experience so he can earn extra income for the family.

loans.use: To buy food supplements and weight loss and weight gain treatments.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child.

Joseph has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

Joseph has been a member of HSPFI for since 2008. In the future, Joseph hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a widow from Trinidad, Bohol. She has one child she takes care of. Mercedita used to sell fish to her community. She was able to acquire farm land and now focuses on rice farming. Mercedita hires workers to till her land and help prepare it for cropping. Mercedita works hard to increase her income and provide a better living for her and her child. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labor.

In the future, Mercedita hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ajok

texts.en:
Ajok is a 30 year-old married woman with three children; one of them is in school. She has a business of selling fish in Bor South Sudan for three years.
Ajok is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 53-year-old Norma married woman with four children aged 24, 23, 20, and 14. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Norma has a seaweed farming business as her source of income. She has had this business for 10 years. Norma said she has a regular buyer of her seaweeds. She earns PHP 6,000 per month through her business.

Norma has requested this loan to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, and wooden pegs. Norma hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, and wooden pegs

loans.name: Aleek

texts.en:
Aleek is a 45 year-old married woman with five children; four of them are in school. She has a business of selling fish in Bor South Sudan for the past two years.

Aleek is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en:
Vergenia is 58 years-old and is a married woman with three children aged 26, 22, and 16. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Vergenia grows and sells seaweeds. She lives in the island, and travels to the mainland to sell her seaweeds. Vergenia also helps her husband sell his catch at their town's market. Vergenia works hard to improve her earnings and support her family. She plans to use her loan to buy fishing nets, straw, and seaweed seedlings.

In the future, Vergenia hopes for her family to experience progress in life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, straw and seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Akon

texts.en:
Akon is a 30 year-old married woman with four children; all children are in school. She has a business of selling fish in Bor South Sudan for the past two years.

Akon is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Agak

texts.en:
Agak is a 36 year-old married woman with six children; four of them are in school. She has a food selling stall business in Bor South Sudan for the past two years.

Agak is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions for sale.

loans.name: Chimedtsogzol

texts.en:
Mrs. Chimedtsogzol, 46 years-old, sells auto goods and spare-parts in the market. She has been running her business since 2003, and already has many customers. She lives with her family in a ger, a traditonal Mongolian nomadic tent in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 
Mrs. Chimedtsogzol wants to expand her business and develop it further. She needs to increase her working capital first as it will expand the sales volume of her business. The loan will be used to purchase a large quantity of sales goods to increase working capital.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of sales goods to increase working capital.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a married woman with 12 children. Her younger children still go to school. Celsa's husband works as a fisherman. 

Celsa is also engaged in fishing. She sells fresh fish at the market. She sells her husband's catch, and also buys from other fishermen. Celsa also makes dried fish to sell. She works hard to support her big family.

Celsa has requested this loan to purchase a boat engine. She hopes to expand their fishing business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine.

loans.name: Chapa

texts.en:
Chapa is a 35 year-old married woman with three children, all of them are in school. She has a business of selling fish in Bor South Sudan for the past three years.

Chapa is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Atef

texts.en:
Atef is a 56-year-old married man, and has worked for the past 22 years as an electrician. He has a shop specialized for repairing all types of power generators, UPS, and any electric machine. 

Atef is an expert in his field, and he is highly recommended by his customers. Atef works hard to update his business; he applied for a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary tools and spare parts for his shop.

He is a man with a very good reputation, encouraged by almost all of his customers to expand and invest more in his business.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools and spare parts for his shop.

loans.name: Faneth Yolanda

texts.es: Faneth es una empresaria de 63 años que se dedica ala comercialización de productos mediantes guías especializadas o catálogos, negocio que inició dese hace mas de 25 años cuando decidió generar ingresos para apoyar el bienestar de su hogar, conformado por su esposo que trabaja como albañil y su hijo hoy de 28 años de edad. Ella está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace 12 años y ha recibido 11 financiamientos que le han permitido mejorar un nivel de vida, aumentando su capital de trabajo  y terminar de construir la casa donde vive, producto de la herencia de sus padres. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer  credikiva, con el cual comprará mercancía variada, especialmente cosméticos y productos de belleza, que están exhibidos en el catálogos, con descuentos que trasladará a su clientes para continuar la fidelización de estos. Su sueño es terminar de adecuar su vivienda para sentirse más feliz.
texts.en:
Faneth is a 63-year-old businesswoman who sells products through specialized guides or catalogs.  She started this business more than 25 years ago to make income in order to support her household which consists of her husband, who works as a builder, and her son, who is now 28 years old.  Faneth has been with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 12 years and has received 11 loans which have allowed her to improve her standard of living, increase her working capital and finish building the house in which she lives (an inheritance from her parents).

Faneth is currently applying for her first Kiva loan which she will use to buy a variety of merchandise, especially cosmetics and beauty products which appear in her catalogs.  She gets discounts which she will pass on to her customers to ensure their continued loyalty.  Faneth's dream is to finish equipping her home so that she feels happier.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise, especially cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Hassane

texts.en:
Hassane is a 25-year-old married man, who has been working as an electrician since 2005.

He is talented in his business and most of his customers recommend him to others.  Hassane is a hardworking man, he has developed himself and seeks to improve his business as much as he can.

Most of Hassane's customers are constructors in addition to his neighbours, relatives and friends.

Hassane is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy the necessary products and tools for a new project he is going to work on.

Hassane is experienced in Al Majmoua loans, with a previously requested loan, which reflected positively on both his social and financial situations.

Hassane hopes to expand his business in the future through opening a special electric maintenance company.

loans.use: to buy the necessary products and tools required for a new project.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a forty year-old lady from Rodi area of Homabay town, West of Kenya. She is married to Maurice, and they have five children aged 12 to 21 years of age.

Jane operates a cereal selling and grinding business, a business she has operated for the last 15 years; she makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a stock of maize cereal for grinding. She will use her profits to educate her children.

Her dream is to have a stable income through her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals for sale and grinding.

loans.name: Las Ñustas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ÑUSTAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Santiago II, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Demetria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: compra y venta de edredones, venta de DVD, venta de ropa, taller de soldadura, costura de mandiles, venta de batidos, venta de regalos.

La señora Demetria,  indica que hace seis años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución de su cuñada. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de soldadura que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo, aprendiendo este oficio mediante su hermana.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de máquina industrial) que adquirirá de las fábricas y posteriormente lo acondicionará en su taller, con la finalidad de trabajar posteriormente con ese equipo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es viuda y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “LAS ÑUSTAS” community bank are starting their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional office.  The group has seven members and is led by a board of directors whose president is Demetria.  The businesses that the members are engaged in are varied and include: buying and selling quilts, selling DVDs, selling clothes, working in a metal shop, sewing aprons, selling shakes and selling gifts. 

Demetria tells us that she has been working with Pro Mujer for six years and that she joined the institution through her sister-in-law.  Demetria currently has a metal shop business which she has been working in for some time.  She learned the trade through her sister.

The loan that she is taking out will be used to increase her capital (to buy an industrial machine) that she will acquire from the factories and then set up in her workshop with the aim of later working with this piece of equipment.  This work allows Demetria to make resources with which to support her family.  She is widowed and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Demetria replied that she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy an industrial machine

loans.name: Tarraiyio

texts.en:
Tarraiyio is 46 years old, married to Kitisian, and they have two children. He has been into the retail shop business for the last 8 years from which he earns a monthly income of about Kes 19,500.

He is applying for his fourth loan of Kes 60,000, and he will use the funds to buy a stock of tomatoes, sugar and fertilizer for resale. He will save the anticipated profits to buy cows.

His hopes are to buy cows and sheep, and in the future to start horticultural farming, growing tomatoes, onions and kale.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, fertilizers and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy women's clothing and articles to sell.

loans.name: Ma Enriqueta

texts.es:
La señora Ma Enriqueta tiene dos hijos que actualmente están estudiando la preparatoria y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar la inscripción, es por eso que solicita un préstamo y así podrá enviar a sus hijos a terminar sus estudios. 
Doña Ma Enriqueta recibe una pensión del gobernó ya que es viuda, también tiene un empleo y sus hijos, mayores le ayudan con los gastos de la casa. 
Desea que sus dos hijos menores tengan una carrera profesional para un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Ma Enriqueta has two children who are currently studying in high school.  She doesn't have the money she needs to pay their registration fees and so she is requesting a loan so that she can send her children to complete their studies.

Ma Enriqueta receives a pension from the government as she is a widow.  She also has a job and her older children help her with the household expenses.  She would like her two younger children to have a professional career so that they can enjoy a better future.

loans.use: to pay high school registration fees for her two children

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther, de 45 años es una mujer valiente. Vive en compañía de Raúl su esposo desde hace 19 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: pero solo vive Econ. 2 de ellos: Ángel y Salí, en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Hualahoyo. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, con la siembra de maíz del cuzco y de colores que es una variedad de la misma y papa. Cuenta con una parcela de terreno agrícola, pero como no es suficiente alquila otras para sembrar en gran cantidad. Ya tiene 12 años de experiencia en el rubro, en todo este tiempo pudo adquirir buenos compradores su cosecha de maíz lo comercializa a Vivero Los Incas, que exporta el maíz que ella produce, asimismo su cosecha de papa, los comercializa a una empresa de elaboración de papa al hilo. Paralelo a este trabajo se dedica a la crianza de toros y gallinas que consume y vende cuando le solicitan. Mientras su esposo trabaja en una mina reconocida, donde percibe un salario mensual y llega a casa cada 20 días. Por lo que Esther es la que se encarga de los negocios. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “barrio oriental” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Esther de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y el pago a los peones que le ayudaran en la próxima siembra de papa y maíz.
texts.en:
45-year-old Esther is a courageous woman.  She lives together with Raúl, her husband for the past 19 years.  The couple have three children but only two of them, Ángel and Salí, still live with them.  They live in their own home which is located in the town of Hualahoyo.

Esther's main business activity is farming.  She grows Cusco corn and colored corn (which is a variety of the latter), and potatoes.  She has a plot of farmland but, as it is not big enough, she rents other plots of land so that she can sow her crops in large quantities.  Esther has 12 years experience in this line of work.  Over this time, she has been able to gain good buyers.  She sells her corn to Vivero Los Incas, which exports the corn that she produces, and sells her potato harvests to a company that makes fries.  In parallel with this work, she also raises bulls and hens which she consumes and sells when people request them.  Her husband works in a well-known mine where he makes a monthly salary and arrives home every 20 days.  For this reason, Esther is the one who takes care of the businesses.

Esther belongs to the 'Barrio Oriental' community bank and this is her ninth loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support as this will make her feel secure in making progress in her work.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Esther will invest the money she has requested in buying natural fertilizers and paying laborers who will help her with her upcoming potato and corn sowing.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and to hire laborers

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: Daniela es una joven de 19 años de edad que viven al suroccidente de la ciudad y ya es toda  una empresaria de su propia  microempresa y  con mucho potencial de crecimiento; sus antecedentes de haber nacido en Barranquilla le dio el espíritu libre y alegre con el que cautiva a la gente que la rodea y su ascendencia de padre y madre antioqueño  y santandereana  respectivamente, le dieron su carácter de persistencia y trabajo disciplinado; es así como responde a su negocio de tienda, el cual emprendió en el año 2010 asesorada por su madre y  que Daniela ha fortalecido, con su perfil de mercaderísta, formación que obtuvo mientras estudió mercadeo  y ventas en una corporación  educativa.  Daniela en su tienda no solo vende víveres, ranchos, licores, carnes, huevos etc., sino que su principal objetivo es satisfacer las posibilidades de compra al detalle de bienes de la canasta familiar a todas las familias que viven a su alrededor. En su tienda se reúnen amas de casa y además de compartir,  compran de contado y a algunas les otorga créditos a cortos plazos. El sueño de Daniela es estudiar comunicación socia y su gran desafío es lograr que a través de sus ingresos en la tienda pueda hacerlo. En el negocio de Daniela la rotación de cuentas por cobrar es de dos días, mientras sus inventarios rotan cada 15 y desde estos indicadores financieros planea su crecimiento empresarial. Daniela está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará víveres, ranchos, licores en mayor volumen para lograr mejores descuentos en el mercado y así mismo mejores utilidades, para cumplir sus propósitos.
texts.en:
Daniela, 19, is a young woman from the southwest part of the city.  She is an entrepreneur and runs a small company with much growth potential.  She was born in Barranquilla which gave her a free, cheerful spirit that captivates the people around her.  Her father being "Antioqueño" and her mother "Santandereana", has given her a determined character and disciplined working habits, which she uses to run her store.  She started her business in 2010 with her mother's advice.  Daniela has strengthened the business with the marketing expertise she learned through corporate sales and marketing training.

In her store, Daniela not only sells groceries, canned goods, liquors, meats, eggs, etc., but also has a main goal of being able to meet all the needs of the typical shopping basket for all the families who live nearby.  Housewives and neighbors meet at her store to share time together.  They pay in cash but sometimes receive short-term credit terms.  Daniela wants to study social communication and her greatest challenge is having the income, through her store, to do so.  Daniela's accounts receivable turnover is two days, and her inventory turnover is 15 days.  These are the financial indicators she uses for company growth.  She will use the Credikiva loan, her first through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy groceries, canned goods, liquors, wholesale, so she can obtain better discounts and payment terms in the market so she can meet her goals.

loans.use: To buy groceries, canned food, and liquors wholesale.

loans.name: Miryan Maricela

texts.es:
Miryan de 22 años, es una mujer trabajadora que comenzó como vendedora de cosméticos y joyas para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares ya que tiene 4 hijos. 

Comenzó a vender cosméticos desde las 08h00am para mejorar sus ingresos.  Durante algunos años ha trabajado para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo cosméticos, aretes, perfumes. En el futuro quiere tener su local establecido.
texts.en:
22-year-old Miryan is a hard-working woman.  She started work as a cosmetics and jewelry saleswoman so that she could help with some of her family expenses as she has four children.

Miryan starts selling cosmetics at 8.00am in order to improve her income.  She has worked for some years in order to be able to help with the family expenses.  She has a lot of aspirations for her business and would like to use this loan to buy cosmetics, earrings and perfume.  In the future, she would like to have established sales premises.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, earrings and perfume

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Josefina tiene 51 años de edad, vive en aldea agua fria, ahi vive con sus dos hijas y se dedica a prestar los servios de costurar, elabora prendas de vestir para damas, como ser vestidos, blusas, trajes. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de unos repuestos para darle mantenimiento a su maquina de costurar y tambien para comprar los materiales para la elaboracion de sus prendas de vestir. 
Maria Josefina a parte de su negocio de costura, vende tortillas y refrescos.
ya viene la epoca escolar y desea estar preparada para cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes, muchas personas mandan a hacer los uniformes de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Josefina is 51 years old and lives in the small village of Agua Fria together with her two daughters.  There she provides sewing services, making ladies' clothing such as dresses, blouses and outfits.  She will use her loan to buy some spare parts so that she can do some maintenance work on her sewing machine.  She will also buy materials which she uses in making her clothing.

In addition to her sewing business, Maria Josefina also sells tortillas and soft drinks.  The school year is about to start and she would like to be ready so that she can cover all of her customers' needs as many people ask her to make their children's uniforms.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her sewing machine, as well as fabric, threads, lace and needles

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil is 34-year-old married man and father of two cute children.  Jamil has worked as a barber since 1997, long enough to give him wide experience in this domain.

Family responsibilities and requests are increasing for Jamil, that's why he thought of making a new business to increase the family's income.  To do so, Jamil applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to start a new business for his wife.

She will start selling cosmetics because she is talented in this field and it is easy for her to market her products among friends, relatives and neighbors.

Jamil hopes to expand his business more in the future, to open a special facial treatment department.

loans.use: to start a new business for his wife.

loans.name: Rayen Mapu Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Rayen Mapu” está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de plantas, preparación de tortas, artesanía, pescadería, venta de abarrotes, entre otros negocios. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Padre de las Casas. 
Cristina presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, en el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, vistiendo una blusa con rayas verticales con tonos blanco y café, sobre sus piernas sostiene su cartera color negro, además usa su cabello corto, el cual es de color castaño oscuro.
Se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, específicamente empanadas. Se desempeña en este negocio desde hace 5 años.
Atiende un kiosco, donde además de las empanadas vende sopaipillas, té, café, bebidas y confites. Este local está ubicado cerca de su casa, al interior de la comunidad mapuche en la que vive. Ahí trabaja todos los días jueves con un horario de 6ºº de la mañana hasta las 14ºº horas. El resto de la semana se traslada en un carretón a diferentes lugares, donde necesiten sus productos. 
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados y ferias libres.
Con el crédito comprará materiales de construcción para mejorar la infraestructura de su kiosco y también comprará mercadería para su negocio.
Sus metas son surgir con su negocio y poder instalarse de manera estable en su local, para preparar y vender sus productos desde su casa.
Cristina vive junto a su marido y su hija de 16 años de edad. Sus sueños son arreglar su casa y salir de vacaciones junto a su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que el grupo del cual forma parte es muy ameno y comprometido.
Padre Las Casas es una comuna del sur de Chile, cercana a la ciudad de Temuco, región de la Araucanía.  Su nombre le fue dado en honor al sacerdote español Bartolomé de Las Casas, quien fue un defensor de los indígenas durante la conquista de América. Destaca una numerosa población mapuche en esta comuna. Basa su economía en la agroindustria y servicios comerciales.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Rayen Mapu" and is comprised of 18 entrepreneurs who are active in different businesses such as plant sales, cake preparation, crafts, fish sales, grocery sales and other businesses.  They all live in the city of Padre de las Casas.

Cristina is the president of the communal bank group.  She is seated in the front row, second from the left in a brown and white striped blouse.  She has short, dark hair and a black bag on her lap.

She makes and sells food, especially "empanadas" (meat pies), and has been in business for five years.  She has a stall where she sells, in addition to the empanadas, "sopaipillas" (fried wheat pastry), tea, coffee, beverages and sweets.  Her stall is located near her house inside the mapuche community where she lives.  She works every Thursday from 6:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.  The rest of the week she works as a street vendor wherever they need her products.

On holidays she buys her merchandise in supermarkets.  She plans to use the loan to buy construction materials to renovate her stall, and also to buy merchandise for her business.  

Cristina lives with her husband and 16-year-old daughter.  Her goal is to renovate her house and go on a vacation with her family.

She is very happy and grateful for this opportunity through Fondo Esperanza, since it will allow her to invest in her business.  She says her group is very nice and everyone is responsible.

Padre Las Casas is a community in southern Chile, near the city of Temuco, in the Araucanía region.  The name is in honor of Spanish priest Bartolomé de Las Casas who defended the indigenous people during the conquest of America. There is a significant Mapuche population in the community.  Its economy is based on agroindustry and commercial services.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to renovate her stall, and to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es: Evarista de 50 años es una mujer responsable. Vive en compañía de su hijos Maycol al que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chilca. Su valentía es admirable, cuidó sola de sus 3 hijos, 2 de ellos ya realizaron su vida, tiene familia y siempre velan por la tranquilidad de su madre. Sigue al cuidado de su hijo al que quiere mucho, por ello todos los días de lunes a viernes trabaja en una mina, por la zona alta de al ciudad, ahí extrae oro, plata y cobre. Recibe buen sueldo por ello, esto le permite cubrir sus gastos, cuenta que muchas veces lava los residuos botados de la mina y extrae pequeñas pepas de oro y plata que comercializa a las joyerías de la ciudad, obteniendo de esa manera un dinero extra. Pero como no siempre tiene este ingreso, comenzó con un pequeño negocio de compra y venta de ovejas y granos, los cuales vende a la capital del país los fines de semana cuando descanso de su trabajo. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “chilca” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Evarista de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ovejas para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
50-year-old Evarista is a responsible woman.  She lives together with her son Maycol who she looks after in her own home, which is located in the town of Chilca.  Her courage is admirable as she brought up her three children on her own.  Two of her children are now living independently.  They have their own families and always look out for their mother.  Evarista continues caring for her remaining child who she loves very much.  For this reason, every day from Monday to Friday she works in a mine in the high area of the city.  There she mines gold, silver and copper, and earns a good wage for it.  This allows her to cover her expenses.  She tells us that she often pans the waste products which are thrown out of the mine and extracts small nuggets which she sells to jewelry stores in the city.  This makes her extra money.  However, as she doesn't always have this income, she started a small business buying sheep and grain which she sells in the country's capital city on the weekend when she has a break from her job.

Evarista belongs to the "Chilca' community bank and this is her fourth loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support as it will make her feel secure in making progress in her business.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Evarista enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Evarista will invest the money she has requested in buying sheep so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 38 years old, married and blessed with two children.  He has been running a green grocer store for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan of KES 50,000 with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully.  He will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruits for his business.  With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and venture into large scale mixed crop farming.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables and fruits for his business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 44 años es una madre responsable. Tiene 2 hijos, pero solo vive con. Yanina, la última hija en casa de su hermana, ubicada en la localidad de Ancalayo. Cuidó de sus hijas, sola, “fue difícil”, comenta pero con la ayuda de su familia pudo salir adelante. Su principal actividad económica es el bordado de fustanes Wanka, que son trajes típicos. Consiste en el bordado a hilo, los cuales vende a 200 nuevos soles, a la semana realiza un promedio de 2 que comercializa en un mercado reconocido de la ciudad. Pero como buena mujer del campo, por temporadas siembra papa y olluco en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, cuenta que en cada cosecha comercializa sus alimentos en la feria de uno de los distritos de la ciudad, donde obtiene buenas ganancias, aprovecha esa oportunidad, para vender los animales que cría entre toros y cerdos. Ahora se encuentra tranquila y con la convicción de sacar profesional a su última hija. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “barrio oriental” y este es el décimo cuarto crédito con MFP, donde esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. María de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de telas y paños para el bordado, además de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
44-year-old María is a responsible mother.  She has two children but only lives with Yanina, her youngest daughter.  She lives in her sister's house which is located in the town of Ancalayo.  María raised her daughters alone.  "It was difficult" she says but, with the help of her family, she was able to get by.  Her main business activity is embroidering 'Wanka' underskirts which are traditional clothing.  She embroiders with thread and sells her products for 200 soles.  She makes an average of 2 products a week which she sells in a well-known market in the city.  However, like every good country woman, she also sows potatoes and olluco (a native tuber) on her own farmland.  She says that when she harvests her crops, she sells them in the market in one of the districts of the city, where she makes good profits.  She makes the most of this opportunity to sell the animals that she raises (bulls and pigs).  Right now, María is calm in the knowledge that she will help her youngest daughter become a professional.

María is a member of the 'Barrio Oriental" community bank and this is her fourteenth loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support as this will make her feel secure in making progress with her work.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  María enjoys being a member of her community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, María will invest the money she has requested in buying material and cloth for her embroidery.  She will also buy natural fertilizers for her upcoming sowing season.

loans.use: to buy material and cloth, and to buy manure for her crops

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 38-year-old married man and father of two children. He has worked in selling home products for 24 years, but he started his own business in 2010.  Kassem also works in painting homes as an additional income to cover his family's expenses.

Kassem is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to pay for his children's school fees and to increase his business capital with a new collection.

Kassem is a hardworking man and he hopes he can keep on providing his children with the best education and healthiest life ever.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and to increase his business capital with a new collection

loans.name: Maria Emerita

texts.es:
Maria Emérita tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, y tiene 3 hijos que estudian con edades de  12, 8 y 3 años, vive con su familia en la Colonia Monterrey de choloma, cortes.  
Maria Emérita se dedicaba a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora. Hace 4 años que realiza su propia actividad de negocio, donde vende Comidas rápidas, como pollo con tajadas, pastelitos, tacos, baleadas…etc,  y almuerzos. Este negocio le ha generado buenas ganancias de donde ha podido cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hijos. Atiende su negocio su negocio desde las seis de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche.
Ha venido superando en su negocio con préstamo y las  ganancias que ha reinvertido, ahora solicita  un préstamo de 15,000 lempiras para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comida, como harina, frijoles, arroz,  condimento y carnes.
Su plan es mantener una buena clientela  para que su negocio le genere los ingresos necesarios para el hogar y llegar hacer auto sostenible.
texts.en:
Maria Emérita, age 33, is single because she is a widow.  She has three children, ages 12, 8, and 3, and they go to school.  She lives with her family in the Colonia Monterrey in Choloma, Cortes.

Maria Emérita used to sell new and used clothes.  She has always been a very hard-working woman.  She has had her own business for four years.  She sells fast food like chicken with sliced plantains, pastries, tacos, “baleadas” (flour tortillas with beans, eggs, butter, cheese and meat), etc. and lunches.  This business has generated good income, and she has been able to cover her children’s basic necessities.  She sees to her business from six in the morning until eight at night.

Her business has been getting better with the loan and the earnings that she has reinvested in it.  She is now requesting a loan for 15,000 lempiras to buy supplies to make food.  She will buy ingredients like flour, beans, rice, condiments, and meat.

Her plan is to maintain a good clientele so that her business generates the income needed by the household and that it becomes self-sustainable.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, condiments, and meat.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es: Magaly, de 25 años es una madre responsable. Vive en compañía de Eder, su esposo desde hace 7 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Mariangel y Farid a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Hualahoyo. Su principal trabajo es la fabricación de ladrillos que realiza junto a su esposo. Su trabajo consiste en realizar los moldes para después quemarlos en el horno. Cuenta que al mes realiza 25 millares, los cuales vende a un proveedor conocido que siempre la visita en su fábrica, pero cuando obtiene mejor propuesta lleva a la capital del país a comercializar sus ladrillos. Paralelo a este trabajo siembra maíz y papa en asociación con una señora que posee terrenos agrícolas, se comparten los gastos y a la cosecha se dividen las ganancias. Los alimentos que obtiene los comercializa a la capital, donde lleva también verduras para comercializarlas en el mercado de abastos. Ahora ella desea juntar dinero para comprarse un camión. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “barrio oriental” y este es el décimo tercer crédito con MFP, donde esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Magaly, de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de aserrín y arena para realizar los ladrillos.
texts.en:
25-year-old Magaly is a responsible mother.  She lives together with Eder, her husband of 7 years.  The couple have two children, Mariangel and Farid, who they care for in their own home.  Their home is located in the town of Hualahoyo.  Magaly's main job is making bricks.  She carries out this work together with her husband.  Her job consists of preparing the molds which are then fired in the oven.  She says that she makes 25 thousand bricks a month and sells them to a well-known supplier who always visits her factory.  However, when she obtains a better offer, she goes to the country's capital city to sell her bricks.  Alongside this work, Magaly also grows corn and potatoes in partnership with a lady who owns farmland.  They share expenses and, when harvest time comes, they divide the profits.  She sells the crops that she grows in the capital, where she also takes vegetables to sell in the wholesale market.  Right now, Magaly would like to put together some money to buy a truck.

Magaly is a member of the "Barrio Oriental" community bank and this is her thirteenth loan from MFP.  She is happy to know that she will have financial support as it will make her feel secure in making progress in her work.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Magaly enjoys being a member of her community bank because the members are all responsible and supportive people.  With your support, she will invest the money she has requested in buying sawdust and sand to make bricks.

loans.use: to buy sawdust and sand to make more bricks

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 38-year-old married man, father of seven children. He has worked as a taxi driver since two years.

Business is going on just fine but he has to do necessary maintenance for his car. With the help of a requested loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, Mohamad will be capable of doing it.

Mohamad already received an Al Majmoua loan and it helped him a lot in both social and financial situations. He hopes to open a taxi company in the future.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance for his car.

loans.name: Agapitus

texts.en: Agapitus is married and has three children ranging between ten and twenty years of age. He describes himself as a visionary man. For the last five years, he has been involved in selling household necessities such as sugar, flour, sodas, baking flour, "Royco", etc., to residents and students within his home area, which is located near a technical training institute. His business challenge is transportation problems when buying and high prices of goods sold. He will use the loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more sugar, rice and baking flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and baking flour.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 43 years old, married to Mary, and they have three children. He has been in the taxi business for the last eight years from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 30,000.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 60,000. He will use the amount to repair his taxi (car). He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With the anticipated profits he will repay his loan.

His hopes and dreams are to build rental houses and to educate his children.

loans.use: To repair his taxi (car).

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 42 years old, married to Florence, and they have one child. He has been in the taxi business for the last seven years from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 20,000.

He is applying for his third loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 50,000. He will use the funds together with his savings to purchase another taxi. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With the anticipated profits he will repay his loan amount.

He also hopes to use the profits to build rental houses and to provide for school fees.

loans.use: To add to his savings and buy another vehicle for his taxi business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 40 years old, married to Lydiah, and they have four children. He has been in the business of operating a public transport vehicle  as well as being a driver for the last five years from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 70,000.

He is applying for his second loan with KADEt Ltd of Kes 90,000 He plans to combine the loan funds and his savings to buy another public service vehicle. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With anticipated profits he will repay his loan.

He hopes expand the vehicle transport business and in future buy lorries for transport.

loans.use: To buy another vehicle  for public transport..

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 53-years-old, married to Mwikali and they have four children. He has been in the trading business buying and selling cereals to his customers for the last 4 years from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 40,000.

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET ltd  of Kes 50,000. He will use the funds to buy stocks of cereals, maize, wheat and beans for sale. He paid the previous loans well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With the anticipated profits he will pay fees for his children's education.

His hopes are to expand the business by buying more cereals for sale and to open another branch.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and cereals for sales.

loans.name: Mawar Group

texts.en: Ni Komang succeeded in maintaining her pigs and her husband supported her business because the result can help to improve the family income. She also succeeded in renovating the barn. Now she needs a new loan to purchase piglets and she also has a plan to buy a sow. Because the loan is not enough to purchase it all, her husband gave her money to support the business. She hopes the sow will give her healthy piglets and she can sell them to other breeders in her village. Ni Komang is on the left side, wearing a red shirt.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and a sow.

loans.name: Piter

texts.en:
Piter is a 49-year-old man who is married to Emi, a 43-year-old lady and has been blessed with four children. 
1.	Alfonsus, 21, working 
2.	Oktavianus, 20, working 
3.	Merlyn, 19, studying at a University in Java Island
4.	Jendry, 6, studying in the 1st grade of elementary School

Piter owns a pig raising business. He has been engaged in the business since 2000. He usually purchases piglets at the market and raises them for six months then resells them to customers. His business is growing well. Recently he sold four pigs. The money was used to pay his daughter’s school fees. Currently he has two pigs to be raised. 

Now Piter intends to buy three more piglets to be fattened and feed for them. He needs more capital to do so. Therefore he is requesting a loan of IDR 6,000,000 from TLM. He hopes that TLM will be willing to provide a loan for the improvement of his business.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets and feed for them.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 47 years old and is married to Timotius, a 52-year-old farmer. They have been blessed with four children: Dedy, 25 and Barnabas, 18; both are working in Papua; Marselina, 17, is studying in the 3rd grade of Senior High School; Imanuel, 15, is studying in the 2nd grade of Junior High School. 

Susana has been running a kiosk business for two years. It is a small kiosk at home. She sells basic needs such as: cooking oil, coffee, salt, cereal and snacks, and candies for children. The income she earns from the business enables her to help her husband in covering her family's daily needs, even though the income she earns is small. 

Currently Susana dreams of improving her business by adding more stock at her kiosk but she does not have capital to do so. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of IDR 7,500,000 from TLM. This loan will be spent on more kiosk stock such as sugar, rice, biscuits, cigarettes and soft drinks. She also wants to help her husband by providing seedlings and fertilizer for their farm. Susana is expecting that TLM will approve her loan application.

loans.use: to purchase more kiosk stock such as sugar, rice, biscuits, cigarettes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar is a 28-year-old married woman with three children; two of them are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for five years.

Yar is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a thirty-two-year-old lady from the ShauriYako area of Homabay town, in the West of Kenya. She is married to Omondi and they have two children, aged two and 13 years.

Eunice operates a shoe selling business in Homabay, a business she has done for the last five years making a monthly income of KES. 6,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a stock of shoes for sale. She will use her profits to diversify into farming.

Her dream is to maintain her business for a stable income.

loans.use: To buy a stock of shoes for sale.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Takku Liggey est composé de quinze femmes qui sont parentes, voisines et amies qui partagent la même confrérie.Il est créé le 9 décembre 2010, l'activité principale des femmes est le commerce.

Madame Dieumb la responsable est âgée de 45 ans, elle est mariée mère de six enfants dont trois filles, elle a un petit fils en charge; elle mène une activité de commerce de légumes. Elle capitalise une bonne expérience de 23 ans; elle accompagnait son père pour l'aider dans le commerce donc elle a une maitrise parfaite de son activité. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo tout à fait à l'extrême habillée en robe wax avec un châle blanc et a levé la main gauche. 

Elle achéte ses légumes dans une ville maraichère et revend au marché central de sa localité.
Son prêt lui servira à augmenter la quantité et qualité des produits afin de se faire plus de revenus.
Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices subvenir à ses besoins mais également participer à l'épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Takku Liggey comprises fifteen women who are parents, neighbors, and friends sharing a camaraderie among them. It was created on December 9, 2010. The main work of the women involves commerce.

Ms. Dieumb, the group's official, is 45 years old and the married mother of six children, including three daughters. She has a grandson to support. She has a business selling vegetables and capitalizes on 23 years of good experience. She used to accompany her father to help him in this business, so she has an excellent command of it. She is the one standing at the far right in the photo and wearing a Wax dress with a white shawl; her left hand is raised. 

Ms. Dieumb buys vegetables from a market-garden town and resells them at the central market in her town. Her loan will serve to increase the quantity and quality of her goods, so as to make more revenues. She wishes to use her profits to support herself but also to help her family to thrive.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Urtnasan

texts.en:
Mrs. Urtnasan, 44, runs an auto service center in her backyard. She lives with her husband and her five children in an old wooden house in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For 12 years she has been running her business and usually 2-3 cars are repaired by her in a week. This number is fewer than in other similar services. But her business has been improving slowly day by day. Currently her business income is the main income source of this family. Now she needs to renovate some of her service equipment. 

This will be a very important and beneficial thing for her business in the long run. The loan she is taking out will be dedicated to purchasing auto service equipment for renovation. She said that her service will be expanded as a company in the next two years if she is able.

loans.use: To purchase auto service equipment for renovation.

loans.name: Munkhtulga

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhtulga, 40, works as a service man in a private company. He lives with his wife and his daughter in an apartment which is in a suburban district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Munkhtulga owns an old Japanese car and he does not have a garage for his car. So his car always is parked outside during the year. But this influences his car and its parts badly. Therefore he decided to build a garage near his home by himself. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchasing the necessary building materials to build his new garage.

loans.use: To purchase some necessary building materials to build his new garage.

loans.name: Akuot

texts.en:
Akuot is a 30-year-old married woman with three children; one of them is in school. She has had a food stall business in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Akuot is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions for sale.

loans.name: Jonius

texts.en:
Jonius is a 32-year-old man and is married to Feronika, a 26-year-old lady. They are blessed with two children: Windy, 6 years old and attending kindergarten and Sesilia, 3 years old. 

Jonius is working as a part-time librarian at a Public Library nearby his house. He has been working there for one year. In addition to working at the library, Jonius also cultivates vegetables: cucumbers, cassava, papayas, cashews, corn, peanuts and string beans at their farm in his spare time. Jonius is assisted by his wife, Feronika, in taking care their farm and selling the crops as well while he is at the library.
 
Jonius is thinking to improve his business; he wants to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. In addition, Jonius wants to buy firewood to resell at the market. This situation led him to request a loan amounting to IDR 5,000,000 from TLM for his business improvement. He is hoping that TLM will approve his loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, pesticides and firewood as well.

loans.name: Hawah

texts.en: Hawah  is a petty trader. She sells panties and groceries in Adum Banso near Takoradi. Hawah has been in this business for two years now. She is married to a mason and has one child. Hawah uses her income to help her husband to pay their accommodation bill. She will use her loan to purchase panties and a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase panties and a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a thirty-nine-year-old lady from Kakamega town, in the West of Kenya and is married to Francis. They have three children aged between 5 and 17 years.

Florence operates a retail shop in Kakamega, a business she has done for the last six years, making a monthly income of Kes 4,700. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a stock of sugar and cooking fat. She will plow her profits back into her business.

Her dream is to be a successful business lady in Kakamega town.

loans.use: To add more stock of sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Akur

texts.en:
sAkur is a 35-year-old married woman with five children; two of them are in school. he has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for four years.

Akur is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ayar

texts.en:
Ayar is a 28-year-old married woman with four children; none of them are in school. She has had a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Ayar is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase onions and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Valeriano

texts.es:
El señor Valeriano tiene en el patio de enfrente de su casa, taller de carpintería. Solicita un préstamo para comprar el materia y construir la losa de concreto y así conectar la casa y el taller y así protegerse del ambiente y también su vivienda ya que es el patrimonio de su familia.
Desea realizar la mejora lo mas pronto posible ya que tiene varios pedidos para entregar y por causa del frio y lluvias no a podido terminar. 
La esposa del señor Valeriano le ayuda con los gastos familiares con su negocio que tiene de dulces, comida y accesorios personales, con las ganancias que obtiene  ambos se hacen cargo de los gastos familiares y escolares.
texts.en:
Sr. Valeriano has a carpenter’s shop in the patio in front of his house. He is applying for a loan to buy the material to build a concrete slab and thus connect the house and the workshop.  This would protect him from the environment and also his home since it is his family’s legacy. 

He wants to make improvements as soon as possible since he has various orders to fill and due to the cold and rains he has not been able to finish them.

Sr. Valeriano’s wife helps him with household expenses with her business selling sweets, food and personal accessories. With the income both receive, they take care of household and school expenses.

loans.use: to construct a concrete slab.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 40-year-old divorced woman who has spent her life taking caring for and raising her children, with the help of her small business that she started 22 years ago. Safaa is a baker. She is specialized in making Lebanese traditional "Saj" bread, almost like pita bread.

Her business is going on just fine, with the support of her customers and with her good quality of products that encourages customers to support her. Safaa is a hardworking mother, who has sacrificed her life for the sake of her children.

She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for the first time, to buy necessary raw materials for her business, such as flour and oil, at very good prices. She might also buy living room furniture for her house, because she really needs it.

Safaa is hoping to expand her business more and to open a special bakery in the future.

loans.use: To increase her business inventory with raw materials such as flour and oil.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia, de 48 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Moisés, su esposo desde hace 16 años. Ambos tienen 6 hijos de los cuales solo vive con 3 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Hualahoyo. Ella se siente dichosa de tener el apoyo de su esposo, quien le ayuda cada vez que pueda. Pues la actividad de ambos es la agricultura, mientra sus esposo trabaja como peón, ella se dedica a l cuidado de sus 8 vacas y 3 toros de las cuales extrae la leche que producen para venderlos a los pobladores de su localidad. Su secreto es sembrar por ella misma alfalfa y de esa manera alimenta a su animales, pero siempre les ofrece comida balanceada y vitaminas para mantenerlos fuertes y que produzcan buena leche. Paralelo a este trabajo siembra maíz, papa; en terrenos alquilados, ya cuando es tiempo de la cosecha los comercializa a los compradores mayoristas que buscan el maíz que solo ella sabe producir. Quiere comprar sus propios terrenos y así depender de ella misma. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “barrio oriental” y este es el décimo quinto crédito con MFP, donde esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Antonia, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más animales y comida balanceada para alimentarlos.
texts.en: Antonia is 48 years old and a hardworker. She lives with Moisés, her husband of 16 years. They have 6 children, 3 of whom live with them in their own home, located in in the community of Hualahoyo. She feels lucky to have her husband's support. He helps her every time he can. Their activity is farming. While her husband works as a laborer, she takes care of 8 cows and 3 bulls. She extracts the milk the cows produce and sells it to the residents of her community. Her secret is planting her own alfalfa and feeding her animals with it, but she always offers them balanced feed and vitamins to keep them strong and producing good milk. At the same time, she also plants corn and potatoes on rented land. At harvest time, she sells them to wholesalers who seek the corn that only she knows how to grow. She wants to buy her own land and rely only o herself. She belongs to the "Barrio Oriental" community bank. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support, since this way she feels sure she can get ahead in her work. On the other hand, she promises to make her payments. She likes being a part of her association because all of the members are responsible and supportive. If Antonia receives your support, she will invest the money she has asked for in buying more animals and balanced feed to give them.

loans.use: to buy more animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en: Ibtisam is a 50-year-old Lebanese widow living with her only child, who is working. She works really hard to be able to offer a suitable life for her child. In 2007, she decided to open her own coffee shop. She was really lucky to open her shop in such a location because it’s a place where all people meet. Today, she’s asking for a loan of $1600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed provisions for her shop such as tea, sugar, Nescafe, and many other items. This investment will improve her business and allow her to serve a wider range of people. In the future, she plans to open new branches in different areas.

loans.use: to purchase needed provisions for her coffee shop.

loans.name: Willis

texts.en:
Willis is a 32-year-old man from the Nyalenda area of Kisumu City. He is married to Maurine, and they have four children.

For the past four years, Willis has operated a clothing business in the Nyalenda area, making a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy children’s clothing, curtains, and ladies' clothes. His profits will be used to educate his children. His dream is to be a wholesale clothing supplier.

loans.use: to buy clothing and curtains to sell.

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter is a 43-year-old lady from Homabay town, Western Kenya. Benter, who is widowed, has two children under her care, aged 24 and 18 years.

For the last five years, Benter has operated a cereal-selling business in Homabay, making a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy a stock of beans to sell. She will use her anticipated profits to buy more stocks of beans and maize. Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of beans to sell.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 38-year-old lady from Lambwe town, Western Kenya. She is married to Ochieng, and they have six children between the ages of 3 and 18 years.

Dorothy operates an agrochemicals shop in Homabay. She has been in this business for the last five years, making a monthly income of KES 8,000. 

She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more agrochemicals to sell. She will use her profits to open other business outlets. Her dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a stock of agricultural chemicals.

loans.name: Moufida

texts.en: Moufida is a 45-year-old Lebanese woman living with her husband and three children. One of their children is studying and the others are working. To meet the heavy costs of life, Moufida and her husband join forces in order to cover at least their necessary expenses. Moufida has been selling homemade food since 1995. She works from her home upon her customers’ demands. Her husband has owned a van since 2006 and works as a taxi driver. Today, she’s asking to borrow $2600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added provisions for her business. This Kiva loan will facilitate her business operations and allow her to boost her productivity. In the future, she plans to open her own homemade food shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional provisions for her food business.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity  is a thirty-six-year-old woman who is married and a mother of two children. She runs a cosmetics shop in Kangemi. Purity has been in the business for four years now and gets a monthly income of fifty-three  thousand  shillings.


This will be Purity’s first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to add more cosmetics to her shop. She wants to plough back the profit she will get into her cosmetics business. 

In future she wants to be able to open two wholesale cosmetic shops in Kinoo and Town.

loans.use: To add more cosmetics to her shop inventory.

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is 31 years old and a retail shop proprietor in Shanzu, Mombasa. He is single. Katana has been a shopkeeper for the past four years and he is doing great. 

This marks his second business loan from KADET Ltd. to finance his business. He plans to purchase more stock of sugar, cooking fat, washing detergents and rice. 

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan. He hopes to do well in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, cooking fat, washing detergents and rice

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is a 30-year-old married woman with four children; two of them are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Roda is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 41-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and five children. Four of them are working and the other one is still attending school. They all cooperate together to enrich their life and live properly. 

Lina started her own home business as a tailor in the year 2000. Today, she needs to borrow $2100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added materials such as textiles for her business. She’s sure that this loan will boost her productivity therefore her sales and thus her revenues.  In the future, she plans to open her own evening dress shop.

loans.use: to purchase added materials such as textiles.

loans.name: Achieng

texts.en:
Achieng is a 28-year-old married woman with six children; four of them are in school. She has had a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Achieng is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 36 years old and from Naivasha. He is married to Magdalene and they have five children aged between 15 years and one year old.

Benson has a business of selling charcoal and has been doing it for the past six years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy more sacks of charcoal to add to his stock.

He hopes to expand his business and employ someone to help him run it.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to add to his stock

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is 22 years old and a married woman with one child who is not in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for one year.

Achol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale
